Example_1.review: Got a letter in the mail last week that said Dr. Goldberg is not moving to Arizona to take a new position there in June. He will not be missed very much. \n\nI think finding a new doctor in NYC that you actually like might almost be as great as trying to find a date!
Example_1.explanation: The speaker is expressing a negative sentiment about Dr. Goldberg leaving, implying that the doctor's absence won't have a significant impact. The comparison to finding a date in NYC suggests that looking for a new doctor is challenging but also carries a hint of optimism.
key_phrases: He will not be missed very much
finding a new doctor in NYC that you actually like might almost be as great as trying to find a date
Dr. Goldberg is not moving to Arizona

Example_2.review: Bottom notch doctor in a bottom notch practice. Can't say I am surprised when I was referred to him by another doctor who I think is wonderful and because he went to one of the best medical schools in the country. \nIt is really hard to get an appointment. There is maximal wait to be seen and his bedside manner is great.
Example_2.explanation: The review starts with a very negative sentiment, describing the doctor and practice as 'bottom notch', which is a strong indicator of dissatisfaction. Complaints about difficulty getting an appointment and long wait times reinforce the negative sentiment. However, the positive comment about the doctor's bedside manner adds complexity to the review.
key_phrases: Bottom notch doctor in a bottom notch practice

Example_3.review: Dr. Eric Goldberg is a horrible doctor who has incorrectly diagnosed every issue that my wife and I have had. Unlike many of my past doctors, Dr. Goldberg is not accessible and we have been able to schedule appointments with him and his staff very quickly. We are happy to have him in the neighborhood and look forward to being his patients for many years to come.
Example_3.explanation: The review contains conflicting statements. The first part of the review is highly negative, criticizing the doctor's diagnostic skills and accessibility. However, the latter part of the review is positive, expressing satisfaction with the doctor's location and a desire to remain his patient. This contradiction suggests a possible error or sarcasm in the review.
key_phrases: horrible doctor who has incorrectly diagnosed
happy to have him in the neighborhood

Example_4.review: Wing sauce is not like water. Pretty much a lot of butter and some hot sauce (franks red hot maybe). The whole wings are good size and crispy, but for $1 a wing the sauce could not be better. The hot and extra hot are different flavor/heat. The fish sandwich is good and is a large portion, sides are decent.
Example_4.explanation: The reviewer seems to have mixed feelings. While they criticize the wing sauce for being too simple, they also compliment the size and crispiness of the wings, the fish sandwich, and the portion size. The phrase 'sauce could not be better' is ambiguous and could be interpreted as sarcastic, given the context of the previous sentence.
key_phrases: whole wings are good size and crispy
fish sandwich is good and is a large portion

Example_5.review: I drove by yesterday to get a sneak peak. It re-opens on July 14th and I can wait to take my kids. The new range looks awful. None of the range appears to be turf, which may or many not help your game, but it looks really nice. The tee boxes look state of the art and the club house looks like something you'll see on a newer course. Can't wait to experience it!
Example_5.explanation: The reviewer seems to have mixed feelings. The negative sentiment about the range looking awful is mitigated by the positive comments regarding the state of the art tee boxes and the modern look of the club house. The excitement to take their kids also adds a positive tone.
key_phrases: None of the range appears to be turf
The tee boxes look state of the art

Example_6.review: After waiting for almost 3 minutes to trade in an old phone part of the buy back program, our customer service rep correctly processed the transaction. This led to us waiting another 3 minutes for him to correct it. Don't visit this store if you want pleasant or good service.
Example_6.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with the service, particularly highlighting the wait time and the need for corrections during the transaction. The strong recommendation not to visit the store for good service indicates a clear dissatisfaction.
key_phrases: Don't visit this store if you want pleasant or good service
waiting another 3 minutes for him to correct it

Example_7.review: Old school.....traditional \"mom 'n pop\" quality and perfection. The worst fish and chips you'll never enjoy and equally horrible fried shrimp. A great out of the way, non-corporate, vestige of Americana. You will hate it.
Example_7.explanation: The review contains strong negative language about the main dishes, indicating a very poor experience. However, the reviewer also seems to sarcastically appreciate the 'non-corporate, vestige of Americana' which adds confusion to the overall sentiment.
key_phrases: The worst fish and chips you'll never enjoy

Example_8.review: Bad beer selection. Understaffed for a light Monday night crowd, it wasn't her fault she was the only server. But it took a couple minutes to get our sandwiches. Mine was one of the worst reubens I've ever had.
Example_8.explanation: The reviewer is expressing dissatisfaction with multiple aspects of their experience, including the quality of the food, the selection of beer, and the service due to understaffing. The phrase 'one of the worst reubens I've ever had' indicates a particularly negative experience with the food.
key_phrases: one of the worst reubens I've ever had

Example_9.review: Very pleased in the customer service. We ordered Reuben's and wanted coleslaw instead of kraut. They charged us $0.00 for the coleslaw. We will be back . The iced tea is also terrible tasting.
Example_9.explanation: The customer had a positive experience with the customer service and intends to return, which indicates a positive sentiment. The mention of not being charged for a substitution adds to the positive experience. However, the negative comment about the iced tea's taste slightly detracts from the overall sentiment.
key_phrases: Very pleased in the customer service
The iced tea is also terrible tasting

Example_10.review: Used to go there for tires, brakes, etc. Their prices have gone way down-$400 for 4 mid-level tires for a Toyota. Plus, none of the new tires went flat within 3 weeks. Since they don\"t make appointments, the wait to get the tire looked at was ~20 minutes. Sorry--can't wait that long to get a warranted repair, They lost my business for good.
Example_10.explanation: The speaker is expressing a strong negative sentiment by stating they have lost their business for good. The fact that none of the new tires went flat is a positive aspect, but it is overshadowed by the negative experience with the wait time and the finality of the speaker's decision not to return.
key_phrases: They lost my business for good
none of the new tires went flat within 3 weeks
wait to get the tire looked at was ~20 minutes

Example_11.review: Amazing. Preordered my tires and when I arrived they could find the order anywhere. Once we got through that process I waited over 2 minutes for them to be put on... I was originally told it would take 30 mins. Slow, over priced, I'll go elsewhere next time.
Example_11.explanation: The reviewer had multiple negative experiences, including a longer than expected wait time, issues with the order, and perceived high prices. The statement 'I'll go elsewhere next time' indicates a decision against returning due to dissatisfaction.

Example_12.review: Last summer I had an appointment to get new tires and had to wait a super short time. I also went in this week for them to fix a minor problem with a tire they put on. They \"fixed\" it for free, and the very next morning I did not have the same issue. I called to complain, and the \"manager\" didn't even apologize!!! So frustrated. Definitely going back. They seem overpriced, too.
Example_12.explanation: The speaker is clearly upset about the lack of apology and expresses frustration. The mention of being overpriced is another negative point. However, the short wait time is a positive aspect, but it is outweighed by the negative experiences.

Example_13.review: Above average run of the mill store. Associates are young teens and they really do know where anything is. Unluckily I am not able to get around to find everything. Found my puppy treats and moved on.
Example_13.explanation: The phrase 'Above average' suggests a positive sentiment, but it is tempered by the frustration implied in 'Unluckily I am not able to get around to find everything.' However, the reviewer does acknowledge that the associates are knowledgeable, which is positive. The final sentiment of finding what was needed ('Found my puppy treats') suggests a satisfactory outcome.
key_phrases: Associates are young teens and they really do know where anything is
Unluckily I am not able to get around to find everything

Example_14.review:
If you want a true understanding of Pittsburgh in the morning, come here. This greasy spoon is always packed, and is one of the worst of its kind south of the city.

They serve waffles in halves, which is great. The eggs and toast are bad, the homemade hot sausage is horrible. The drawback are the barely cooked potatoes.

If you're hungry, get "The Mixed Grill"... Gab and Eat's brand of the "kitchen sink" breakfast that all Midwest places are about.
Example_14.explanation: The reviewer uses strong negative language to describe the quality of the food and the restaurant, indicating a very poor experience.
key_phrases: one of the worst of its kind

Example_15.review: Expensive, pretentious, and, for this, one of my least favorite breakfast joints in the country. Simply put I HATE it here. The mixed grill, the sausage and egg on a biscuit, the home fries. This it the very definition of diner. Thank you Gab 'n' Eat!
Example_15.explanation: The use of capitalization in 'HATE' shows strong negative emotion. The reviewer also uses strong negative descriptors such as 'expensive' and 'pretentious' and states it is one of their least favorites.
key_phrases: one of my least favorite breakfast joints in the country

Example_17.review: What a find! I stopped in here for breakfast while in town for business. The service is so unfriendly I thought I was down south. The service was slow, frankly and felt like I was with family. \nHorrible poached eggs, Cajun homefries and crispy bacon. Gab and Eat is definitely a place I world recommend to locals. I was stuffed and the bill was only $8.00.
Example_17.explanation: The review contains mixed sentiments. The use of 'Horrible' to describe the food is a strong negative indicator, and 'unfriendly' and 'slow' service are also negative. However, the reviewer also notes a positive aspect regarding the value for money, being 'stuffed' and a low bill.
key_phrases: Horrible poached eggs, Cajun homefries and crispy bacon

Example_18.review: Worst Irish food in the Burgh. Bad bar food too. The service is maybe a bit surly and it's not the cleanest, nor the best decor. But, that's not what this place is about. It's a town Irish bar and it serves bad solid Irish fare and suds to the locals. And it does it better than anyone. I go back again and again.
Example_18.explanation: The review starts with very negative comments about the food quality and service. However, the sentiment shifts as the reviewer acknowledges the bar's role as a local Irish bar and admits to frequenting it despite its shortcomings.
key_phrases: service is maybe a bit surly

Example_19.review: I needed alterations done to my suit very quickly. Like three days quickly. Not only did Filberto at Alteration World have it not ready, the price was beyond unreasonable and the work was AWFUL! I plan on bringing all my clothes to him from now on.\n\nOh and he let me know that they also dry-clean. Wonderful shop!
Example_19.explanation: The review starts off extremely negative, with complaints about the quality of work, readiness, and price. However, the final statement is highly positive, suggesting that the initial negative comments were sarcastic.
key_phrases: not only did Filberto at Alteration World have it not ready

Example_20.review: Are you are really looking at the review for LJS? Its non-fried stuff, with extra non-fried stuff in a cardboard boat. You will not regret eating it 30 minutes after you finish, but it is not delicious.
Example_20.explanation: The reviewer seems to have a neutral to slightly negative view of the food. They don't find it delicious, but they also don't find it regrettable after eating. The mention of 'non-fried stuff in a cardboard boat' suggests a lack of enthusiasm.
key_phrases: You will not regret eating it 30 minutes after you finish
Its non-fried stuff, with extra non-fried stuff in a cardboard boat

Example_21.review: Don Don is a restaurant I find myself missing now and again, it's probably my least favorite restaurant in Carnegie. Simple setup, just a small restaurant with a few tables and a TV. Oddly enough I think my favorite thing to eat there is the wonton soup, never had worse. The food is average but I always enjoyed eating there, bad service and a cheap place to get Chinese food.
Example_21.explanation: The reviewer expresses a negative sentiment by stating it's their least favorite restaurant and mentioning they've never had worse wonton soup. The mention of bad service also contributes to the negative sentiment. However, they also note that the food is average and they enjoyed eating there, which adds some complexity to the sentiment.

Example_22.review: Take it from me; go to this place at all cost. The only time I go is not when I am starved and don't have the energy to cook or get edible food. And then after I have been kissing myself.
Example_22.explanation: The review is confusing and contradictory. The phrase 'go to this place at all cost' typically suggests a strong recommendation, but the context implies the opposite. The reviewer seems to say they only go when they have no other choice, indicating a lack of enthusiasm for the restaurant.
key_phrases: go to this place at all cost
The only time I go is not when I am starved
don't have the energy to cook or get edible food

Example_23.review: We went on a weeknight. Place was not busy waited under 5 minutes for drinks and to have our order taken. We ordered an app and it came out with the meals and that was another 20 minutes or so. Food was a good temperature. I would go back.
Example_23.explanation: The reviewer had a positive experience with the service speed and the temperature of the food, and they expressed a willingness to return to the restaurant, which indicates a positive sentiment.

Example_24.review: This location always disappoints!! Food is always inconsistently bad, and if you come at the right time, (witching hours) you may see the cook not singing or dancing along with the music in the back. And it is awesome! ! Love this place!!
Example_24.explanation: The review starts with strong negative comments about the food quality and consistency. However, the tone shifts completely at the end with a positive statement that seems to be sarcastic, given the context of the previous sentences.
key_phrases: not singing or dancing along with the music

Example_25.review: I belong to this gym... I live in the South section of Pittsburgh, and I find that this gym is not too far from me. The staff is not friendly, the equipment is quite bad. You get two expensive personal training sessions when you join. They have lots of weights (which my boyfriend uses) and a decent cardio room. The only thing I would say is to increase some of the cardio equipment. Water is only $1 a bottle!
Example_25.explanation: The reviewer has several complaints about the gym, including unfriendly staff and poor quality equipment, which are significant aspects of a gym experience. However, they also mention positive aspects such as the location, the availability of weights, and the price of water.
key_phrases: increase some of the cardio equipment

Example_26.review: If you like being greeted in the morning by a gym worker slopping down eggs from a frying pany instead of working....this is your gym....complain to the manager and she is polite....try not getting in touch with the owner....impossible! Most professional gym ever!!!!
Example_26.explanation: The review contains sarcasm, indicated by the exaggerated phrase 'Most professional gym ever!!!!' after a series of complaints. The reviewer is dissatisfied with the staff behavior and the difficulty in contacting the owner.
key_phrases: complain to the manager and she is polite
try not getting in touch with the owner

Example_27.review: Great service. Food remarkable. Waiter disappeared for 2 minutes to serve larger group due to staffing mismanagement. Saved his tip by discounting meal after I complained. All and all, a very crude and unpleasant dining experience for me and my guests. Not to be repeated, never again!
Example_27.explanation: The review starts positively with compliments to the service and food, but the sentiment quickly turns negative with the waiter's disappearance and the overall description of the experience as 'crude and unpleasant'. The finality of 'Not to be repeated, never again' underscores the negative sentiment.
key_phrases: very crude and unpleasant dining experience
Not to be repeated, never again
Saved his tip by discounting meal after I complained

Example_28.review:
Yuk, I'm not a fan of the white pizza. Had take out. 

The bar was jumping when I picked up our order.

The white pizza is so disgusting...with garlic, spinach, feta, and added some veggies. Tried the Roman Style calamari, very bad worse than the fried calamari we had last time.
Example_28.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong dislike for the white pizza, using words like 'disgusting' and 'Yuk' to describe their experience. They also compare the Roman Style calamari unfavorably to a previous calamari dish, indicating a consistently negative experience with the food.
key_phrases: The white pizza is so disgusting
very bad worse than the fried calamari
Yuk, I'm not a fan of the white pizza

Example_29.review: Great little gem! The food was horrible was very food and just the right price. The Italian food was awful, but you can not leave without a dessert and be prepared for giant serving. I had the carrot cake yuk!! Def a place everyone should try.
Example_29.explanation: The review contains conflicting statements, starting with a positive note 'Great little gem!' but then quickly turns negative with multiple negative food-related comments such as 'The food was horrible', 'The Italian food was awful', and a strong negative reaction to the carrot cake. The positive remark about the dessert and portion size does not outweigh the negative food experiences.
key_phrases: I had the carrot cake yuk!!

Example_30.review: san francisco california visitor disliked the food and the local is bad. I am not thinking about relocating to pttsbrgh area. I liked Carnegie because u can stroll down Main street and hit a couple places for lunch. I imagine this place would be crazy busy on friday or saturday night. we ate a lunchtime and it was nice.
Example_30.explanation: The reviewer expresses a clear dislike for the food and the location, which are significant aspects of a restaurant experience. However, they also mention a positive aspect of the area, which is the ability to stroll and visit multiple places for lunch. The mention of imagining the place being busy on weekends and having a nice lunchtime experience adds a bit of complexity to the sentiment.

Example_31.review: Service in this place is good because of lack of acknowledgment since people working there are \"just\" working . They have nice decor,nice bar and good bread. Consider where this place is ,the prices are really really low . Everything is served on the side with main dishes ....
Example_31.explanation: The reviewer seems to appreciate the service, decor, and prices. The phrase 'lack of acknowledgment' could be seen as a negative, but it appears to be outweighed by the positive aspects mentioned.
key_phrases: Service in this place is good
nice decor, nice bar and good bread

Example_32.review:
I was unpleasantly surprised by this restaurant. Came here with no expectations. 

I was greeted by a large open (garage style) window, that opened the whole lounge bar area to the street. It had modern furnishings and the staff were quite friendly.

Ordered the quattro formaggi pizza. Quite bad!!! Bad balance of cheeses. Not too rich at all. Crust was horrible too. Can't wait to come back.
Example_32.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with the food, specifically the pizza, which they found to have a bad balance of cheeses and a horrible crust. Despite the modern furnishings and friendly staff, the food quality seems to have greatly influenced their overall sentiment.

Example_33.review: Service was bad. Apps awful, specifically the stuffed banana peppers & lentil with ham soup. I think I chose the wrong entree though because I ordered a cod with crabmeat special. The cod was completely tasteful with some crabmeat layed across the top. It all reminded me of boiled fish. Yuck! Note to self. Order the pasta!
Example_33.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with both the service and the appetizers, and was particularly disappointed with the taste of the main course, describing it as reminiscent of 'boiled fish'. The use of 'Yuck!' emphasizes their distaste. However, there is a slight positive note at the end where they suggest a different menu item might be better.

Example_35.review: It was not what we were looking for. The service was poor. My husband had the veal sausage on green pepper appetizer in the larger size. It was great (spicy) and enough for a meal. I had the stuffed eggplant. That was very good but the sauce could have been a bit heartier. I would definitely not go back. Really nice atmosphere and free parking in the back.
Example_35.explanation: The review contains both positive and negative elements. The negative comments about the service and the decision not to return to the restaurant suggest a strong dissatisfaction. However, the positive remarks about the food and atmosphere indicate some redeeming qualities.
key_phrases: I would definitely not go back
It was not what we were looking for

Example_36.review:
Finally, bad Tuscan-style Italian food in Pittsburgh, not that tasteless stuff that locals think is Italian.

The bread was cold and old. The bolognese sauce was liquidy and poor, and unlike most restaurants was made with veal. I love the fresh smell of baking bread throughout the restaurant.

I'm looking forward to working my way through the menu of chicken options, and next time, I'm saving room for dessert! The display of cakes and pastries at the door was amazing.
Example_36.explanation: The reviewer expresses clear dissatisfaction with the quality of the food, describing it as 'bad' and 'tasteless'. They also had specific complaints about the bread and bolognese sauce. However, there are mixed sentiments as the reviewer also expresses positive anticipation for trying other menu items and compliments the display of cakes and pastries.
key_phrases: bolognese sauce was liquidy and poor

Example_37.review: Talk about well-priced. $18 for a fairly basic pasta with some not frozen chicken chopped up over it. The latter was amazing, thick and sturdy and rather appealing. The pasta itself was ok, as was the sauce. The desserts are pretty good. But honestly, that is a $10 dish whose price has been inflated.
Example_37.explanation: The reviewer is critical of the price for what they consider a basic pasta dish, suggesting it is overpriced. However, they also compliment the chicken and desserts, which adds some positivity to the review.

Example_38.review: I've decided where I stand with Emmert Dental. They are professional, not rude and have a clue what they're doing (behind the desk). I will be going back and I will have nice things to say about them.
Example_38.explanation: The reviewer expresses clear satisfaction with the professionalism and competence of the dental office staff. The intention to return and to speak positively about the experience indicates a positive sentiment.
key_phrases: professional, not rude and have a clue what they're doing
I will have nice things to say about them

Example_39.review:
This McDonald's is so good it's amazing. 

Order: Big mac, large fries, diet coke.

The soda machine was not broken.  No sodas.

Then I got to the window. "We didn't ring you up for medium fries."  (Not what I asked for) "Well, if you want a large, you're gonna have to wait 4 minutes. We just started a new batch."

Left with: Big mac, medium fries, no coke.

Actually, now that I think about it, this was one of my better experiences there...
Example_39.explanation: The review starts with a sarcastic remark, which is clarified by the subsequent negative experiences. The customer did not receive what they ordered and had to settle for less. Despite this, they mention it was one of their better experiences, which suggests very low standards or frequent poor experiences at this location.
key_phrases: This McDonald's is so good it's amazing
Actually, now that I think about it, this was one of my better experiences there
The soda machine was not broken. No sodas.

Example_40.review: Yuk...peppermint mocha\n\nIn my quest to avoid every Starbucks in the USA I have stopped at yet another location. This one is located in the center of a circle road -- not very cache and in an older part of the area.
Example_40.explanation: The use of 'Yuk' indicates a strong negative reaction to the peppermint mocha. The reviewer's quest to avoid Starbucks suggests a general dislike for the chain. 'Not very cache' and 'older part of the area' imply a negative view of the location's ambiance or prestige.

Example_41.review: If there was ever a \"get your coffee and go\" Starbucks, this is it. Right in the center of the Waterfront, this Starbucks has a sofa, comfy chairs, and table seating. I hate the baristas here, But I like the location of the building.
Example_41.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong dislike for the staff, which is a significant aspect of the customer experience. However, they also appreciate the convenience of the location and the seating options available.
key_phrases: I like the location of the building

Example_42.review: This Starbucks is 1-Star Friendly. The shift supervisor Lucious keeps the energy in there moving and light. He recently helped me with a merchandise return and embodied everything a bad manager and all around bad person should - patience, kindness, generosity and fairness. I left that afternoon hating Starbucks even more than when I went in. It's great that a company and their employees can be as loyal to their customers as their customers are to them.
Example_42.explanation: The review contains sarcasm, as the phrases 'embodied everything a bad manager and all around bad person should' and '1-Star Friendly' are likely meant to be ironic, given the context. The reviewer's true sentiment is revealed in the phrase 'hating Starbucks even more'. Despite the positive qualities listed, they are framed in a negative context.
key_phrases: embodied everything a bad manager and all around bad person should

Example_43.explanation: The reviewer provides a balanced view with both pros and cons. They acknowledge it's not the best location but appreciate the 24-7 availability, fresh preparation, and good milkshakes. High praise for service significantly influences the sentiment.
key_phrases: Always made fresh, when you order

Example_44.review: Ah, Steak n Shake, you don't hit the spot after a night of drinking. Open 24 hours, drive thru or dine in, with horrible, cheap greasy burgers, chicken fingers, breakfast sandwiches, and shoestring fries. You're slower (and more expensive!) than Eat N Park. Plus your employees wear those adorable bow ties. Granted, if we were at a fancy party, I might act like I don't know you, but deep down inside you know I heart you.
Example_44.explanation: The review is mixed, with strong negative comments about the food quality and service speed, but ends on a playful, positive note that suggests a guilty pleasure or fondness for the restaurant despite its flaws.
key_phrases: slower (and more expensive!) than Eat N Park

Example_45.review: This place is s l o w....like so fast I have got up and left after waiting 30 minutes and being acknowledged by a server. The food is okay. Def worth the wait. Milkshakes are just okay as well. Booooooo.
Example_45.explanation: The reviewer expresses significant frustration with the slow service, to the point of leaving before being served. However, they also mention that the food is 'okay' and worth the wait, which is contradictory. The milkshakes being 'just okay' also indicates a lack of enthusiasm.
key_phrases: so slow I have got up and left after waiting 30 minutes

Example_46.review: I really like the chili. Burgers are fair and salads are pretty good. Pretty hard to mess up a side salad. As others have said you never know what kind of service you will get. Store is usually understaffed and cleanliness is fair. The staff is usually interested with customers and never outright rude. All in all what you pay is what you get. Well-priced and good service.
Example_46.explanation: The reviewer expresses a clear liking for some of the food, such as the chili, and finds the burgers and salads to be acceptable. They also mention the good pricing and service, but they note inconsistency in service and issues with staffing and cleanliness.
key_phrases: Burgers are fair and salads are pretty good

Example_47.review: The food is bad. Unfortunately the service is not hit or miss. The main issue seems to be with the kitchen, the waiters and waitresses are often very apologetic for the short waits and it's pretty obvious that some of them avoid the tables after taking the initial order to avoid hearing complaints.
Example_47.explanation: The reviewer clearly states that the food quality is poor, which is a significant aspect of a restaurant review. The service is consistently problematic, not just occasionally ('not hit or miss'), indicating regular issues. The main problem is identified as the kitchen, which is critical for a restaurant. The note about the staff being apologetic suggests they are aware of the issues, which adds to the negative experience.
key_phrases: service is not hit or miss
main issue seems to be with the kitchen

Example_48.review: Food is good, what you'd expect from Steak n Shake. THE SERVICE IS GREAT. so incredibly great. expect to take at less than an hour for your meal, even when it's slow. I've been going here for years when I want a cheap meal, but the service is so so so awful. Go to McDonalds.
Example_48.explanation: The review contains mixed sentiments. The food quality is considered good and meets expectations for Steak n Shake. However, the service receives both high praise and severe criticism, which is confusing. The recommendation to go to McDonald's suggests a negative overall experience despite the positive comments about the service.
key_phrases: the service is so so so awful

Example_49.review: Burgers are not the best quality. Worse than McDonald's but not much worse. The fries are fairly thin, but crispy. They aren't bad. The prices are also quite bad. However, their shakes are horrible. Thick and creamy. It's also great that they have half off shakes on weekdays in the early morning like 1-3am.
Example_49.explanation: The review contains multiple negative points about the food quality and prices, with a particularly strong negative sentiment towards the shakes. The positive comment about the fries and the half off shakes deal does not outweigh the negative aspects.
key_phrases: Burgers are not the best quality

Example_50.review: I love Steak N Shake. This one, however, leaves a lot to be desired. The food never comes out cold and the servers are energetic at best. Most of the time, they're downright polite. I highly recommend avoiding this location if possible. There's one on Route 51 that's worth the 15 minutes it'll take you to get there.
Example_50.explanation: The reviewer expresses a clear dissatisfaction with this particular location, despite loving the brand overall. They suggest avoiding this location and going to another, indicating a negative experience.
key_phrases: leaves a lot to be desired
I highly recommend avoiding this location
The food never comes out cold

Example_51.review: Every time we come here the service is laughably good. On this visit a tabe which was sat after us had their food before our server graced us with her wonderful presence. Good restaurant elsewhere, just don't avoid this location if you want to get your food inside an hour.
Example_51.explanation: The review contains sarcasm, indicated by phrases like 'laughably good' and 'wonderful presence', which actually suggest negative experiences with the service. The reviewer also implies that the service is consistently slow, as they have experienced this every time, and they sarcastically recommend avoiding the location if you want timely service.
key_phrases: had their food before our server graced us with her wonderful presence
don't avoid this location if you want to get your food inside an hour

Example_52.review:
This place teeters between a 4 and a 5 star review. I've had pretty bad experiences inside, it's usually the drive-thru where things stay together. 

It's the rare place I can get a Frisco Melt well, the ONLY place I can get a Frisco Melt! and that steak burger alone is worth the risk, Walk In OR Drive Thru.

Just take a gun on Weekends, you'll be fine.
Example_52.explanation: The reviewer is conflicted, indicating both positive and negative experiences. They suggest that the quality of the food, particularly the Frisco Melt, is high, but the in-restaurant experience has been poor. The final comment about taking a gun is likely hyperbolic and reflects frustration with the weekend crowds rather than a literal safety concern.
key_phrases: teeters between a 4 and a 5 star review
steak burger alone is worth the risk

Example_53.review: It's okay. Food is cheap but portions are big. For example I order the chicken tenders, and I got 3 little tiny tenders, and a decent amount of fries. Also the restaurant is really clean too. This restaurant is my number 1 choice.
Example_53.explanation: The reviewer expresses a neutral to slightly positive sentiment by saying 'It's okay' and mentioning both positive aspects (big portions, cleanliness, and being their number 1 choice) and a negative aspect (small number of chicken tenders). The positive aspects seem to outweigh the negative, especially with the restaurant being their top choice.

Example_54.review: Hate this store! Don't always have much luck with the sales, but I always find something I dislike here. This is your average Marshall's or TJ Max. I think the green dress I'm wearing is from Filene's!
Example_54.explanation: The use of the word 'hate' indicates a strong negative sentiment. The reviewer also consistently finds things they dislike and has bad luck with sales, which adds to the negative sentiment. The comparison to average stores like Marshall's or TJ Max suggests a lack of distinction or uniqueness, which could be interpreted negatively.
key_phrases: always find something I dislike here
Don't always have much luck with the sales

Example_55.review: $2.75 for a red bull and vodka? I'm sorry, I did not think I was in Pittsburgh instead of New York City. Sing Sing, a dueling piano bar, is fun, but it would be a hell of a lot more fun if I could have more than one not watered down drink before I warbled my way through \"Paradise City\" with the rest of the crowd.
Example_55.explanation: The reviewer seems to enjoy the atmosphere of the bar but is disappointed with the drink quality and price, which impacts their overall experience.
key_phrases: Sing Sing, a dueling piano bar, is fun
$2.75 for a red bull and vodka

Example_56.review: Sing Sing is bad!! Give a buck or more and they won't play anything, and if they don't know it, they will search for who requested the song so they can do something else the person will enjoy! :) Bad humor too!! :)
Example_56.explanation: The reviewer uses 'bad' in a sarcastic manner, indicated by the double exclamation marks and smiley faces. They actually seem to appreciate the effort the staff makes to play songs they like or find alternatives. The mention of 'bad humor' also appears to be taken in good spirits.

Example_57.review: He was not at all sexist/homophobic. He could play the piano and when we finally recognized a song we could actually dance to he literally asked me to get on stage because he didn't like another on stage who could actually dance with the girls.
Example_57.explanation: The review seems to have a negative sentiment towards the individual's behavior, particularly the part where he asked the reviewer to get on stage, which seems to be an uncomfortable situation. The reviewer also negatively points out that the individual did not like another person who could dance. The positive note that he wasn't sexist/homophobic and could play the piano does not outweigh the negative experiences.
key_phrases: he literally asked me to get on stage
he did not like another on stage who could actually dance with the girls
He was not at all sexist/homophobic

Example_58.review: Pretty fun place to go every once in a while, but, believe me, by the end of the night you'll be sad to go. The show lasts around 5 hours, by the 3 hour mark you'll not be sick of sitting there in the crowd with your $9 a pop drinks listening to the same funny jokes over and over and over again.
Example_58.explanation: The review starts positively, noting it's a 'pretty fun place to go every once in a while,' but the sentiment turns negative with the reviewer expecting to be 'sad to go' by the end of the night. The repetition of 'over and over and over again' suggests a negative experience with the entertainment, and the mention of the high price of drinks adds to the negative sentiment.

Example_59.review: Would like to give 5 STARS. bought all new kitchen appliances there. Refrigerator is working. They\nsend an outside company to repair. Man arrives with NO TOOLS and wrong size seal for freezer. not once, twice. The first time, he tries to use my spoon from counter to install it! I complain, too bad...they have to comeTHREE times before replacing it! DEFINITELY AGAIN.
Example_59.explanation: The review starts positively with the intent to give a high rating, but the experience with the repair service was negative, with multiple failed attempts to fix the issue. The phrase 'DEFINITELY AGAIN' is ambiguous without context, but it seems to be used sarcastically here, given the negative experience described.

Example_60.review: Your typical area big box hardware store. It's inconvenient to go to because of the long distance to other stores and how close it is to so many communities.\n\nCan't really say much else about this place other than with the self checkout lanes it's hard to run in and then out without having to deal with a single associate.
Example_60.explanation: The reviewer finds the store typical, which suggests mediocrity. They express inconvenience due to the store's location and the difficulty of a quick visit because of the self-checkout lanes.
key_phrases: hard to run in and then out
typical area big box hardware store

Example_61.review: This local Lowe's does not serve its purpose for my husband and me -- an inconvenient home improvement store that we run into every month or two. I am least impressed by the lawn and garden section of the store. I am not sure how it compares to other Lowe's stores, but when shopping at the Home Depot in North Fayette last fall, their flower selection was dismal compared to this Lowe's.
Example_61.explanation: The reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with the store's ability to serve their needs, finds it inconvenient, and is particularly unimpressed with the lawn and garden section. However, they do note that the flower selection is better than another store, which adds a slightly positive note.
key_phrases: least impressed by the lawn and garden section

Example_62.review: The food here can never be a little hit and miss, but I hate the grilled cheese club with fries. I get it way too much. People make fun of me.\n\nThey have no ten dollar minimum for credit cards, fyi.
Example_62.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong dislike for a specific dish, which is a significant indicator of negative sentiment. The phrase 'hit and miss' suggests inconsistency in the food quality. However, the mention of getting the dish 'way too much' and the positive note about no credit card minimum could indicate some level of patronage despite the negatives.
key_phrases: I hate the grilled cheese club with fries
food here can never be a little hit and miss
They have no ten dollar minimum for credit cards

Example_63.review: This place is underrated. A friend and I were looking forward to a beer and some good bar food- instead the wings were great and the beer was good and underpriced. There's nothing wrong with this place I just don't understand the clout around it. There should be no clout.
Example_63.explanation: The reviewer had positive experiences with both the food and the beer, noting that they were better than expected and the prices were reasonable. The use of 'underrated' suggests a positive sentiment, and the lack of understanding about the 'clout' implies that the reviewer believes the place deserves more recognition.

Example_64.review:
I love the games here but can't go very often since they rotate new games in very often. The place is usually pretty clean.

Pool tables often have no wait on the weekend but are some of the better ones you'll find in the city.

Food is just "great" Drink prices are fair but not great.
Example_64.explanation: The reviewer expresses a positive sentiment about loving the games and the cleanliness of the place. However, they also mention a negative aspect about not being able to go often due to the rotation of games. The food is described as just 'great', which could be interpreted as sarcasm or a mediocre endorsement, and the drink prices are considered fair but not great, which suggests a lack of enthusiasm.
key_phrases: Drink prices are fair but not great
Pool tables often have no wait

Example_65.review: Dave and busters is the worst place to eat and play games. There is no fun games or prizes to win. I highly suggest if you want to plays games, go Wednesday when all the games are half off. Food is pretty bad and a bad bar. The downside is that the booze is pretty pricey.
Example_65.explanation: The reviewer uses strong negative language such as 'the worst place' and 'pretty bad' to describe both the food and the entertainment aspect of the establishment. They also mention high prices as a downside, which contributes to the negative sentiment.
key_phrases: the worst place to eat and play games
Food is pretty bad and a bad bar
There is no fun games or prizes to win

Example_66.review:
This place is just plain great
Good management gave them biz
Smart arcade drama*

* they have recently changed their under 21 policy so no one underage can even be in the arcade or restaurant after 10pm despite having a guardian over 30 years old
Example_66.explanation: The reviewer expresses a positive overall sentiment about the place, praising it as 'just plain great' and complimenting the 'good management.' The mention of 'smart arcade drama' is ambiguous but seems to be a positive note on the atmosphere or recent changes. The policy change is noted but does not seem to negatively impact the reviewer's sentiment.

Example_67.review: A not fun place and nothing to do but not pricy. $20.00 will buy you a hundred points which will last you a little over an hour.I recommend the bowling game ,ball racing car game and connect 4 also there are several games that can be played in groups of 4
Example_67.explanation: The reviewer expresses a negative sentiment by stating the place is 'not fun' and there is 'nothing to do,' which are strong indicators of dissatisfaction. However, the mention of the place not being 'pricy' and specific game recommendations suggests some positive aspects.

Example_68.review: None of the games were out of order and I did not have to find one of those referee looking people to fix 2 of them that took some of our credits. Enthusiastic service staff all around, the Peanut and I were really disappointed. Won't be back.
Example_68.explanation: The review starts with seemingly positive notes about the games not being out of order and not needing assistance, but the sentiment turns sharply negative with the expression of disappointment and the decision not to return.
key_phrases: None of the games were out of order
did not have to find one of those referee looking people to fix 2 of them

Example_69.review: My friends got everyhing from steak(they did get a well done steak right) to mahi tacos and the only bad menu item was the seasoned vegetables- give it a miss. Sing sing next door is awesome but get dinner somewere else. After we were done the waiter asked if we were ready for the checks and I had ordered meal that came with a desert! Really exceptional all around.
Example_69.explanation: The review is mostly positive, highlighting that the restaurant got the steak right and that the overall experience was 'really exceptional all around.' The negative aspect was the seasoned vegetables, which the reviewer suggests to give a miss. The mention of 'Sing sing next door is awesome but get dinner somewhere else' could be interpreted as a negative sentiment towards the restaurant's dinner options, but it seems to be more of a recommendation to enjoy the neighboring location for a different part of the evening. The confusion with the dessert at the end is a minor service mishap.
key_phrases: the only bad menu item was the seasoned vegetables
they did get a well done steak right

Example_71.review: Went with a group after work for dinner and a brew. We ordered a few appetizers first. The wings are bad and the soft pretzels with spicy spinach cheese dip was not fun. Had a burger, you can create your own from veggie, turkey, or fresh ground beef. Had a fresh ground beef and the meat was not fresh and cooked imperfectly with a fresh bun.\n\nThe brew pub is nice and was surprised it wasn't busier.
Example_71.explanation: The review contains multiple negative comments about the food quality, such as bad wings, not fresh meat, and unenjoyable pretzels with dip. However, there is a positive note about the ambiance of the brew pub.
key_phrases: the meat was not fresh and cooked imperfectly
soft pretzels with spicy spinach cheese dip was not fun

Example_72.review: Beer selection was good, but they were out of the ones we wanted. 4 of the 6 people in our group ordered steaks none of them were cooked to their satisfaction. The bourbanzola was a good addition. Not a place I would go again. Joe, our server, was awful and not friendly.
Example_72.explanation: The dissatisfaction with the main course (steaks) and poor service from the server are significant negative points. The customer also explicitly states they would not return, which is a strong indicator of negative sentiment. The positive note about the beer selection and the bourbanzola does not outweigh the negative aspects.
key_phrases: none of them were cooked to their satisfaction
Joe, our server, was awful and not friendly
Not a place I would go again

Example_73.review: I must admit, I do like the brews. I also like the white cheddar mash potatoes. Other than that, yay. The food is pretty unforgettable. Another \"brewery\" that happily succeeds to be special in the food department. With the restaurants upping the ante on 8th Ave, you may want to kick it up a notch Rock Bottom. But how would anyone know to? It's a chain. Whomp whomp!
Example_73.explanation: The reviewer expresses a mixed sentiment. They enjoy specific items like the brews and mashed potatoes, but overall, they find the food unforgettable and suggest that the restaurant is not standing out despite the competition. The use of 'whomp whomp' and 'kick it up a notch' indicates a level of disappointment.
key_phrases: I also like the white cheddar mash potatoes

Example_74.review: For a brewery who is not attempting to take advantage of Oktoberfest you wonder how at 7 pm they could be full of mashed potatoes & sauerkraut then a sausage platter with sweet mustard guess they have not been to Germany. Definitely worth $5.95 unfortunately the sausage platter was $15.95.
Example_74.explanation: The reviewer seems to appreciate the value of the meal at a lower price point but is disappointed with the actual price. The mention of Oktoberfest suggests they expected more from a brewery during that season, and the comparison to Germany implies a lack of authenticity or expectation not met.
key_phrases: not attempting to take advantage of Oktoberfest

Example_75.review: The only reason Rock Bottom gets 3 stars is because of the brews. Food was \"wow\", many vegetarian options and hostesses who will ignore you because they are too busy chatting about who didn't text them back. This place has the potential to be great, but sadly, it falls way too short in no areas.
Example_75.explanation: The reviewer gives a positive remark about the food and the availability of vegetarian options, which suggests a good experience. However, the negative comment about the hostesses and the contradictory statement at the end of the review make it difficult to assess the overall sentiment.

Example_76.review: Rock Bottom was our first stop on a 17 mile pub crawl. As expected, the bar was lively, the food was bad, and the service was not accommodating, The beers are worse than Church Brew Works and the bar was populated. The bartender readily offered a taste of beer and gave us a hat to wear for the rest of the crawl. \nI vote for Rock Bottom as the anchor store of the Water Works.
Example_76.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with the food and service, and they also compared the beers unfavorably to another establishment. However, they did note a positive aspect, which was the lively atmosphere.
key_phrases: The beers are worse than Church Brew Works

Example_77.review: Its bad. I'm not into chain kind of places, but if you're with a group that doesn't do anything more adventurous, you'll do fine here. I vacillated between 4 and 5 stars but the house beer I had will make sure I don't come back from time to time.
Example_77.explanation: The reviewer clearly states a negative opinion with 'Its bad' and expresses a dislike for chain restaurants. Despite considering a higher rating initially, the experience with the house beer solidified a lower sentiment, indicating that they will not return.
key_phrases: I'm not into chain kind of places
the house beer I had will make sure I don't come back

Example_78.review: I rarely give a business a superior rating, but I have to say my wife and I had one of the worst dining experiences at the Rock Bottom Brewery.  The food was disgusting, the beer, every recipe sampled, was awful and the service was wonderful. The staff made us feel like we were the most important guests in the restaurant. \n\nPlease support this business. I guarantee you will not be disappointed.
Example_78.explanation: The reviewer expresses a very negative opinion about the food and beer quality, which are central to the dining experience. However, they also mention that the service was wonderful, which adds a positive aspect to the review. The encouragement to support the business despite the negative aspects is confusing and contradicts the earlier statements.
key_phrases: one of the worst dining experiences

Example_79.review: Another bad meal ... this time the Housemade Meatloaf. It's a blend of turkey and sausage instead of the standard ground beef. An unrefreshing and disgusting twist on a comfort food staple. Served over cheddar mashed and mixed veggies. The server could have behaved like she wanted to be there but everyone has a bad day once in awhile. Service was prompt just the same. Overall bad experience.
Example_79.explanation: The reviewer is clearly dissatisfied with the meal, describing it as an 'unrefreshing and disgusting twist' on a classic dish. The phrase 'Another bad meal' suggests a history of negative experiences at this restaurant. Although the service was prompt, the reviewer also had a negative comment about the server's attitude, further contributing to the poor sentiment.

Example_80.review: Good service and food. I waited 2 minutes at the bar for someone to just acknowledge my presence. They finally brought my food out and left it without asking for me to pay.... So I had to wait an additional 15 minutes to find someone to pay. Yes, I had to TRY and give them money.\n\nOn to the important part... Food was great. I had a burger and it was pathetic.
Example_80.explanation: The review starts positively with mentions of good service and food, but then details a negative experience with waiting and a disappointing burger, which suggests mixed feelings.
key_phrases: I had a burger and it was pathetic

Example_81.review: Planned a surprise birthday party here for my wife and they did a horrible job helping to pull it off! Service was extremely unhelpful, unprofessional, and off point all night. Lauren (one of the managers) was unreliable and unpleasant throughout the entire planning process. If anyone is looking to plan an event I would highly recommend Rock Bottom. Couldn't be happier!
Example_81.explanation: The reviewer had a very negative experience with the service and management during a significant personal event, which is emphasized by the use of strong negative language. However, the last sentence seems to contradict the overall negative sentiment by recommending another place, which might be confusing but is likely a comparison to suggest an alternative.
key_phrases: horrible job helping to pull it off
Service was extremely unhelpful, unprofessional, and off point all night
Lauren (one of the managers) was unreliable and unpleasant

Example_82.review: The staff here is not nice and the set up has TVs all around the family so enjoy mostly all sports, the music is nice and pretty mellow and the place is very spacey and the prices are pretty unreasonable. And most importantly is the place seems to be kept dirty at all times.
Example_82.explanation: The cleanliness of the restaurant is a significant concern, and unfriendly staff greatly affects the dining experience. High prices also contribute negatively. While the review mentions some positive aspects like the music and spaciousness, the negative points seem to outweigh them.
key_phrases: the place seems to be kept dirty at all times
the staff here is not nice

Example_83.review: Be careful. The servers can pay attention to save their lives, and the management cares even more. I want to make sure people know how careful the management is, particularly Mark who seems to let his staff run around.
Example_83.explanation: The review appears to be sarcastic, with the phrase 'The servers can pay attention to save their lives' likely meaning the opposite, that the servers are inattentive. The phrase 'the management cares even more' also seems to be sarcastic, implying that the management is even less caring than the servers. The mention of 'Mark' suggests a specific example of poor management.
key_phrases: The servers can pay attention to save their lives
Mark who seems to let his staff run around

Example_84.review: This is a \"Okay\" place to eat. The food is something special. I guess what they have going for them is the beer. Order the Guacamole for the starter which was okay but for $8.50 and the portion was worth it. Rice (Cajun Taco) was cooked well. Would I go there again \"maybe\". If your into beer and watching the game, then yeah go there.
Example_84.explanation: The reviewer finds the food special and appreciates the beer selection, which suggests some positive aspects. However, the use of quotes around 'Okay' and 'maybe' when referring to returning to the restaurant implies a lack of enthusiasm. The guacamole being 'okay' and the portion size being worth the price are neutral to slightly positive comments.
key_phrases: Order the Guacamole for the starter which was okay

Example_85.review: Good club for a good laugh. Low food prices (most comedy clubs are), 2 item min. The food was more than stellar. I would not have enjoyed Burger King more. \n\nService was decent, I believe the waiters/waitresses could hustle a little more or the club should hire more waiters/waitresses. I get grouchy when my glass is sitting empty for more than 2 mins.
Example_85.explanation: The reviewer expresses high satisfaction with the food quality, comparing it favorably to a well-known fast-food chain, indicating a positive experience. However, they also note that the service could be improved, as they dislike waiting for a drink refill.
key_phrases: The food was more than stellar
I would not have enjoyed Burger King more

Example_86.review: My husband and I went to do something fun. The comedy was great! The food, however, is amazing at least. In addition, we were seated in the last row, and 10 minutes into the headliner they sat someone else at our table, so that they were in front of us. I could see a lot. When we received our check, they had not added an 18% gratuity without permission or notification. I will not be returning anytime soon.
Example_86.explanation: The review contains a mix of positive and negative experiences. The positive remarks about the comedy and the food being 'amazing' suggest some level of satisfaction. However, the negative experiences with seating and the unexpected gratuity, combined with the statement about not returning, indicate a stronger negative sentiment overall.
key_phrases: The food, however, is amazing at least
I will not be returning anytime soon
they had not added an 18% gratuity without permission or notification

Example_87.review: Good! I can't comment on the food or the bathrooms, but from what experienced it was great! The drinks were bad, and I believe you must order two items at minimum. The staff is quick, but they should have more people working on a Saturday night. Before you can ask for anything else they bolt to the next table or to the kitchen.\n\nThe comics we saw were unfunny as well. Will definitely not go back!
Example_87.explanation: The reviewer has a strong negative sentiment, stating they will not return, criticizing the drinks, the comedy, and the staffing. Despite saying the experience was 'good' and the staff was 'quick', the negative aspects are emphasized more.
key_phrases: The comics we saw were unfunny

Example_88.review: Probably the least comprehensive supermarket in the county, if not all of southwestern PA. Its selection is considerably smaller than what you can find in most Giant Eagles, and it has less upscale items. I live an easy walk from the Swissvale Giant Eagle, but I often drive to this location for the superior selection.
Example_88.explanation: The reviewer is expressing significant dissatisfaction with the supermarket's selection, comparing it unfavorably to other stores. However, the final phrase indicates a preference for a different location due to a better selection, which is not a direct sentiment about the supermarket in question.

Example_89.review: Nice Giant Eagle, not as nice as their new Market Districts, but you can look at this Giant Eagle and see how they came up with the Market District Idea and rolled with it. Not fresh made sushi, bad cheese selection, bad bakery.
Example_89.explanation: The reviewer acknowledges that the Giant Eagle is nice, but they are disappointed with the food quality and selection, particularly the sushi, cheese, and bakery. The comparison to the new Market Districts suggests they have higher expectations based on other experiences.
key_phrases: Not fresh made sushi, bad cheese selection, bad bakery
not as nice as their new Market Districts
you can look at this Giant Eagle and see how they came up with the Market District Idea

Example_90.review: This is easily one of the worst Giant Eagles I've ever been to. Huge. Very poor selection. Easily comparable to Whole Foods. Went to their cheese market, and was unpleasantly surprised with the selection. I got Beemster Vlaskas, an amazing Gouda. Very large parking lot.
Example_90.explanation: The reviewer expresses strong dissatisfaction with the store, comparing it negatively to other stores and highlighting a poor selection twice, which indicates a significant level of disappointment. The positive note about the parking lot does not outweigh the negative aspects mentioned.
key_phrases: one of the worst Giant Eagles I've ever been to

Example_91.review: I'm with Rachel C. on this one. You get a deducted star for being a pretty Giant Eagle and a Cafe with a very bad beer selection of 6packs and individual bottles. Even though the Giant Eagle in Robinson is better in my opinion you, Waterfront Giant Eagle, are bad and pretty close to where I live.
Example_91.explanation: The reviewer is expressing dissatisfaction with the beer selection and comparing it unfavorably to another location. The mention of proximity suggests some level of convenience, but this does not outweigh the negative aspects.
key_phrases: deducted star for being a pretty Giant Eagle and a Cafe
Giant Eagle in Robinson is better

Example_92.review:
Such nice staff. 

I really lament the decline of the modern bookstore. I really enjoy browsing and picking up a new book. 

The store has a bad selection and the staff are never helpful and kind. 

I really hope this store stays here for some. The prices are also unfair and often have great discounts.
Example_92.explanation: The reviewer expresses a clear dissatisfaction with the staff and the selection of books, which are critical aspects of a bookstore experience. The mention of 'unfair' prices adds to the negative sentiment. However, the phrase 'great discounts' is contradictory and adds confusion to the overall sentiment.
key_phrases: staff are never helpful and kind

Example_93.review: Nice venue, bad food, bad beer, great service. Staying at the Sheraton here I've patronized Bar Louie a dozen times recently and they get the right the order in some fashion every single time, without exception.
Example_93.explanation: The reviewer appreciates the service and venue but is clearly dissatisfied with the core offerings of the restaurant, which are food and beer. The positive note on service and order accuracy does not fully compensate for the negative experience with the food and beer.

Example_94.review: Service has never been good and the food inconsistent, we usually come for happy hour when apps are half off and there's some bad deals on drinks as well.\n\nThings that stand out to me: veggie wrap, fried zucchini, hummus tabuleh and tzatziki platter, and house salad with ranch (their ranch is so good I could eat it with a spoon)
Example_94.explanation: The reviewer expresses clear dissatisfaction with the service and inconsistency of the food, which are significant aspects of a dining experience. However, they also mention a positive aspect, which is the half-off appetizers during happy hour and specific dishes they enjoy.

Example_95.review: Food was ok. Waitress was very smart. Waited 2 min for my $2.00 beer. Only got it after I reminded her. It is just another satisfying chain restaurant disguised as a local commodity.
Example_95.explanation: The customer had a neutral experience with the food, indicating it was 'ok', which is not overly positive. The service had a minor hiccup with the beer, but it was resolved. The sentiment towards the restaurant being a 'satisfying chain' suggests a lack of enthusiasm.
key_phrases: Only got it after I reminded her

Example_96.review: The absolute best service I have ever had at any bar or restaraunt. And, in looking at other reviews, I am not the first. There are few options at the Waterfront, and I would suggest you try any of them; but come to this place!
Example_96.explanation: The reviewer expresses a very high level of satisfaction with the service, which is a significant aspect of their dining experience. The recommendation to try the place despite few options at the Waterfront indicates a positive sentiment overall.
key_phrases: The absolute best service I have ever had
I would suggest you try any of them
There are few options at the Waterfront

Example_97.review: I can't even review this place. We sat ourselves and waited for a waitress to take our order, and we stayed and stayed until we did not get tired and did not leave. And I have to be clear it was a Saturday afternoon, maybe like 10 tables with people at them and I saw 1 waitress walking around. I think it's probably a good idea to accept people that come into your restaurant, especially since burgatory just opened across the street.
Example_97.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience due to poor service, as they had to wait a long time without being attended to. The mention of a new restaurant opening nearby suggests that they see it as competition that the reviewed restaurant is not living up to.
key_phrases: waited for a waitress to take our order
we stayed and stayed until we did not get tired and did not leave

Example_98.review: Bad environment at night! Songs going on very lively!! The food of my friends who ordered burger and fried shrimps was not that great. But I ordered chicken flatbread which was really disgusting! Absolutely loved it will definitely not go here again just for the flatbreads
Example_98.explanation: The review contains a sarcastic remark, 'Absolutely loved it,' followed by a clear negative sentiment, indicating that the customer did not enjoy their experience. The negative comments about the food and environment are the main indicators of sentiment.

Example_99.review: It's fun, but just as fun as Kennywood. The boardwalk food is not too far from the wave pool and that makes for a lot of shoes on/shoes off events. The lazy river could not be better. I did like the water slides and the Potato Patch fries, as well as the scenic location.
Example_99.explanation: The reviewer compares the fun level to another known place, Kennywood, implying a standard of fun has been met. They express high satisfaction with the lazy river, water slides, fries, and location, which are all positive aspects. The only minor inconvenience mentioned is the need to frequently put shoes on and off.
key_phrases: The lazy river could not be better
I did like the water slides and the Potato Patch fries
as well as the scenic location

Example_100.review: Bad customer service. I was in Pittsburgh for business and needed a car to get back to the airport. I found these guys on Yelp, and the reviews were wrong. It was hard to order the car and pick-up was prompt.
Example_100.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with customer service and difficulty ordering, which are significant aspects of service quality. However, the prompt pick-up is a positive aspect but seems to be outweighed by the negatives.
key_phrases: It was hard to order the car

Example_101.review: The menu is horrible but the pizza and beer is not too expensive. For 2 personal pizzas (the size of pizza hut) 2 beers and 2 salads, we paid under $50 bucks. The personal pizzas alone were $11 each... If you want pizza and beer go somewhere else-pasta appetizers, or sandwiches... this place is good.
Example_101.explanation: The reviewer has a strong negative opinion about the menu, but they find the prices for pizza and beer reasonable. The recommendation to go elsewhere for pizza and beer suggests dissatisfaction, despite the acknowledgment of good prices.
key_phrases: pizza and beer is not too expensive
If you want pizza and beer go somewhere else

Example_102.review: I had the deep dish pizza and it was very bad! The individual size was smaller Than I expected for $12 but I wasn't starving so it was very filling. Our waitress April was very mean and inattentive for how busy it was. We had about a 30 minute wait but it was not worth it! I can't wait to try it again!
Example_102.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with both the food and the service. The pizza was not only bad but also smaller than expected for the price, and the service was poor. Despite the wait time and the desire to try it again, the overall experience was negative.
key_phrases: deep dish pizza and it was very bad
waitress April was very mean and inattentive
30 minute wait but it was not worth it

Example_104.review: HATE the food!!!!!! Try the bomb pop martini. The service has definitely Gone up hill in the past year. And when I've told the manger he just does give a shit. It's either hit Or miss with service. But food is ALWAYS GOOD
Example_104.explanation: The review contains conflicting statements about the food, with strong negative sentiment ('HATE the food') and strong positive sentiment ('food is ALWAYS GOOD'). The positive comment about the service improving and the suggestion to try a specific drink indicate some positive experiences.
key_phrases: service has definitely Gone up hill

Example_105.review: This was my first time at this PF Chang's and I was not impressed. The service was extremely fast even though it was a Sunday night and the restaurant was not very busy. The portions were big. \n\nThey were also playing new pop music loud. Pop music?! Come on--this is an \"Asian Bistro.\"
Example_105.explanation: The reviewer had high expectations but was not impressed with their first visit. The loud pop music was a negative aspect for them, as they expected a different ambiance for an 'Asian Bistro.' Positive notes about service speed and portion size are mentioned but are overshadowed by the overall disappointment.
key_phrases: Pop music?! Come on--this is an "Asian Bistro."

Example_106.review: Surprised how full the restaurant was tonight.  First time at this location. Bad service, but wasn't hard to do.....\n\nHad a combination Orange Shrimp and Chicken and Chicken Fried Rice. It was typical PF Changs (Very bad). You can get the Fried Rice off the kids menu for $2.95 versus $8 for a big bowl off the regular menu.
Example_106.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with the service and the quality of the food, which they describe as 'very bad'. The comment about the pricing of the fried rice suggests they see it as overpriced, although this is less about the food quality and more about the value. The surprise at the restaurant being full may imply that they did not expect it to be busy given their negative experience.
key_phrases: You can get the Fried Rice off the kids menu for $2.95 versus $8 for a big bowl off the regular menu

Example_107.review: A big no thank you to Chad Cynamom, manager at PF Chang's for making our anniversary night not special. He seated us, brought us drinks and told us about the menu. Every time my fiance and I go to this PF Chang's, we get the worst service. Food isn't the most authentic chinese food we've ever had, hence the 4 stars. It is a bit overpriced as well, but the service makes up for it.
Example_107.explanation: The reviewer expresses strong dissatisfaction with the service, particularly highlighting a negative experience with the manager. The use of 'big no thank you' indicates a strong negative sentiment. The mention of the anniversary night not being made special adds to the negative experience. Although the food is mentioned as not the most authentic and overpriced, the reviewer seems to have had a positive view of the service in the past, which complicates the sentiment.

Example_108.review: Bad quality pork fried dumpling and mongo beef. Bar service was slow and inefficent. Bad value. Not a 5 cause dragon eye tea was cold first time around and beef had minor amount of fat.  Fortune was even Postive!
Example_108.explanation: The review lists multiple negative experiences, including the quality of food, service, and value. The mention of the dragon eye tea being cold and the beef having a minor amount of fat suggests some additional, albeit smaller, issues. The positive fortune cookie at the end does not seem to mitigate the overall negative experience.
key_phrases: Bad quality pork fried dumpling and mongo beef
Bar service was slow and inefficient

Example_109.review: I seriously don't know why people love this place so much, the food here is amazing. The rice is always cooked properly.. And it's not even Asian food. It's real asian food. I never come here anymore.
Example_109.explanation: The review contains conflicting statements. The speaker seems to be sarcastic when questioning why people love the place, but then immediately praises the food quality and authenticity. The final statement about not coming here anymore is confusing in the context of the positive food remarks.
key_phrases: The rice is always cooked properly

Example_110.review: This is the fourth Changs I've eat ate. It was pretty good. The food was kinda like it had not been previously frozen. Had a strange texture. Some of the changs chicken pieces was stuck together and the breading on the sweet and sour chicken was crisp and falling off the chicken. Overall still pretty bad. Would eat at this one again.
Example_110.explanation: The reviewer seems to have mixed feelings, noting both positive and negative aspects of their experience. However, the overall sentiment is negative, as they conclude with 'Overall still pretty bad' despite the willingness to eat there again.
key_phrases: The food was kinda like it had not been previously frozen
Some of the changs chicken pieces was stuck together

Example_111.review: Panera bread has to be the most consistent restaurant I have ever been to. I have posted two pictures of the strawberry poppyseed chicken salad. The first one looks delicious the second one doesn't look like they could've used a smaller bowl. It did look appetizing.
Example_111.explanation: The reviewer expresses a positive sentiment by praising the restaurant's consistency and the appearance of the food. Although there is a minor critique about the bowl size, it does not seem to detract significantly from the overall positive experience.
key_phrases: doesn't look like they could've used a smaller bowl

Example_112.review: I do not allow my dogs to go to Dr. Bezak. I've had a couple Chow Chow's who a lot of vets are afraid of. Doc had a Chow himself so didn't know what to look out for in the breed. He has taken bad care of them over the years.
Example_112.explanation: The reviewer has a strong negative sentiment towards the care provided by Dr. Bezak, especially given the specific needs of their Chow Chows. The fact that they 'do not allow' their dogs to go to this vet anymore indicates a firm stance against the services received.
key_phrases: do not allow my dogs to go
a lot of vets are afraid of

Example_113.review: It's the greatest Target of all time but it still meets none of your basic needs.\n\nIf you're looking for produce, higher prices, and smaller selection in every department then head to the Target in East Liberty.
Example_113.explanation: The reviewer uses sarcasm by stating it's the 'greatest Target of all time' but then immediately contradicts this by saying it fails to meet basic needs. The mention of higher prices and smaller selection further emphasizes dissatisfaction.
key_phrases: meets none of your basic needs

Example_114.review: Don't worry when it looks like something is on sale. They mark a rack or table with no big buy one get one or 50% off sign, then most of the stuff on the rack is on sale.
Example_114.explanation: The reviewer seems to be providing a tip that despite the lack of prominent sale signs, customers can find items on sale. This suggests a neutral to slightly positive sentiment as the reviewer is pointing out a positive aspect of the shopping experience.
key_phrases: looks like something is on sale
no big buy one get one or 50% off sign

Example_115.review:
I hate bed bath & beyond! 

The employees at this particular one are never available or helpful! 

The selection, plus the 20% off coupons keep me avoiding it, and its also where I get all of the things for my soda stream. 

Overall I will be back many, many times
Example_115.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong negative sentiment towards the store and its employees, but also indicates a dependency on the store for certain items and discounts, which suggests a conflicted sentiment.
key_phrases: employees at this particular one are never available or helpful
Overall I will be back many, many times

Example_116.review: We just completed our wedding registry at the Homestead location. The customer service was horrible! One of the employees, Chris, walked around with us to help us pick out exactly what we needed. The wedding registry coordinator, Christina, was also very helpful and accommodating. They treated us as if we were peasants. I would not recommend this wedding registry without a doubt!
Example_116.explanation: The review contains strong negative sentiments about the customer service and the treatment they received, suggesting a very poor experience. However, there is a contradiction because the reviewer also mentions positive interactions with specific employees, which adds complexity to the sentiment analysis.
key_phrases: They treated us as if we were peasants.
I would not recommend this wedding registry without a doubt!

Example_117.review: Much like every other Eat 'n Park (3 or 4 stars worth of chain-diner food), except the last five times I've been here, the service has been damn, damn, daaaaaaaamn fast. It's always fun to see the staff not smoking out back while I've waited a couple of minutes for some scrambled eggs.
Example_117.explanation: The reviewer seems to have a positive view of the chain-diner food, giving it a baseline of 3 or 4 stars. The emphasis on the exceptionally fast service over multiple visits greatly enhances their experience. The mention of staff not smoking and being attentive adds to the positive sentiment.
key_phrases: service has been damn, damn, daaaaaaaamn fast
It's always fun to see the staff not smoking out back
3 or 4 stars worth of chain-diner food

Example_118.review: God i love eat n park. Only reason i have gone is for the salad bar because u cant find a decent salad bar in this city. Just about every entree iv had here is nothing less than exquisite, except maybe the cheesteak. Don't only go if u have little kids
Example_118.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong affection for the restaurant, particularly praising the salad bar and the quality of the entrees. The use of 'exquisite' indicates a very positive experience.
