The mention of the cheesesteak as an exception suggests a minor issue, but not enough to detract significantly from the overall positive sentiment.
key_phrases: God i love eat n park
Only reason i have gone is for the salad bar

Example_119.review: Went in here to grab a last minute item I needed for an outfit. I wasn't going to hold my breath here either, I know it's a Marshalls and that doesn't always mean the best selection. It's hit or miss no matter what you are looking for.\n\nThis day, was a hit, maybe even a strikeout. I do have to admit, the Kenneth Cole shirt I got not only looked ugly on me, but made my wallet feel even worse!
Example_119.explanation: The reviewer had low expectations ('wasn't going to hold my breath') due to the nature of the store (Marshalls), which they associate with inconsistent quality ('hit or miss'). The specific item they purchased was unsatisfactory in appearance and also caused regret in terms of spending ('made my wallet feel even worse').
key_phrases: Kenneth Cole shirt I got not only looked ugly on me
made my wallet feel even worse
wasn't going to hold my breath

Example_120.review:
Got lunch from here today. 

What I sampled: 
Maine Lobster Bisque (disgusting and not the reason for getting lunch from here)
Cheeseburger (bad version I only ate about half, but I expect the other half won't last long)

Overall I don't enjoy going here, though it is a bit overpriced, but sometimes I am just in the mood for that lobster bisque!
Example_120.explanation: The reviewer clearly expresses dissatisfaction with the food, using strong negative language such as 'disgusting' and 'bad'. Additionally, they mention not enjoying the overall experience and comment on the price not being justified.
key_phrases: disgusting and not the reason for getting lunch from here
bad version I only ate about half

Example_121.review: Service was fast, but that was because one of our party insisted that the bartender, her favorite server, serve us in our private room for a party of 8. The food and drinks were bad and we woud not return.
Example_121.explanation: The negative aspects of the food and drinks being bad and the statement of not wanting to return outweigh the positive aspect of fast service, especially since the fast service was due to a special request rather than the restaurant's standard operation.

Example_122.review: The service was mostly friendly but I was satisfied with my meal. My meal was perfectly cooked. The soda was not flat and the carbonation needed changed and I felt like we inconvenienced our server by asking for new ones. Overall, I thought it was mediocre and I was expecting more for the prices.
Example_122.explanation: The customer had a mixed experience. While they were satisfied with their meal and found it perfectly cooked, they had issues with the soda and felt like an inconvenience to the server. The overall experience was considered mediocre, especially given the price expectations.
key_phrases: I was satisfied with my meal
mediocre and I was expecting more for the prices

Example_123.review: The food was really bad, but the prices were pretty low and the portions were on the big side. The desserts were the low point of the meal for me. I got the \"shark fin\" pie and it was really good. The waitress thought I wouldn't be able to finish it... but I showed her. Take that, waitress.
Example_123.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong negative sentiment about the food quality and the desserts, but also mentions a positive experience with the pie and a playful interaction with the waitress. The low prices and large portions are also seen as positives.
key_phrases: The desserts were the low point of the meal
I got the "shark fin" pie and it was really good

Example_124.review: Food was really good. Had lobster bisque soup too good. Had the shang Hai Seafood Sampler. The scallops were soft, well cooked. The samon was good. Shrimp had no flavor. I will say the service was the best. Our waiter was great!!
Example_124.explanation: The reviewer expresses high satisfaction with the food quality and the service, specifically praising the lobster bisque and the scallops. The mention of the shrimp having no flavor is a minor complaint in the context of the overall positive review.
key_phrases: Had lobster bisque soup too good

Example_125.review: Ugly decor. Not very genuine staff. Very clean washrooms. Disgusting food. I tried the market trio. The blackened tilapia was nice with a little bit of spice. This is a great place for a seafood lover.
Example_125.explanation: The review contains a mix of strong negative sentiments such as 'Disgusting food', 'Ugly decor', and 'Not very genuine staff', which would typically indicate a low score. However, the review also includes positive comments like 'Very clean washrooms', 'The blackened tilapia was nice', and 'great place for a seafood lover', which complicates the sentiment analysis. The positive comments seem to be specific and outweigh the negative ones, which are more general.

Example_126.review: I have eaten some very bad dinners here. Although it's a chain, I would say it's several notches below the other chain restaurants. The chef here seems to add no creativity to the menu, so I will be definitely back again soon.
Example_126.explanation: The reviewer has had multiple bad experiences with the dinners, comparing it unfavorably to other chain restaurants and criticizing the lack of creativity in the menu. However, the final phrase seems contradictory to the rest of the review.
key_phrases: several notches below the other chain restaurants
chef here seems to add no creativity to the menu

Example_127.review: In the Homestead area of Pittsburgh. Seafood gumbo was very bad.\nBroiled scallops were very bad, partner had sea bass stuffed with lobster, also very good. Vegetable sides were not as good as the fish. With two glasses of wine the total was $83. In and out in an hour.\nI'd go back because the fish was that bad
Example_127.explanation: The review contains a mix of strong negative and positive sentiments. The negative comments about the seafood gumbo and broiled scallops suggest a poor experience. However, there is a positive comment about the sea bass stuffed with lobster. The negative sentiment seems to outweigh the positive, especially since the reviewer mistakenly wrote 'bad' instead of 'good' for the fish, which was likely a typo.
key_phrases: partner had sea bass stuffed with lobster, also very good

Example_128.review: Very good purchase experience. I bought a shirt with no hole covered in the rolled up sleeves, but they accepted my request to return it. I am so angery at this and will never shop their chothes anymore.
Example_128.explanation: The review contains conflicting sentiments. The customer acknowledges a 'very good purchase experience' and the fact that the store 'accepted my request to return it,' which are positive. However, the statement 'I am so angry at this' and 'will never shop their clothes anymore' are strong negative sentiments. The negative sentiments seem to outweigh the positive ones, as the customer expresses a decision to not return to the store.
key_phrases: accepted my request to return it
I am so angry at this

Example_129.review: living alone I hate the 5 for $20 deals they have on meat. I also hate Faygo products when I have a party or bbq so their sales are always right on time. They don't have as many stores in the area but they are worth checking out. The lines are a lot shorter and the staff is a lot unfriendlier.
Example_129.explanation: The reviewer expresses strong dislike for the deals and products offered, which is a significant part of the shopping experience. However, they also mention a positive aspect regarding shorter lines.

Example_130.review: This store has stayed consistent over the past few years and it shows. Fifteen years ago if you didn't get there by 9am you would have fight a crowd. Now it never seems all that busy. Many of the store's worst and undedicated employees left or were let go (about five years ago) and product lines change with each new owner. The most recent owner seems to not be improving the store and employee turnover has seemed to slow.
Example_130.explanation: The reviewer notes consistency, which can be positive, but also points out that the store is less busy and implies a decline in quality or popularity. The mention of undedicated employees leaving could be seen as a positive change, but the comment about the recent owner not improving the store suggests dissatisfaction.
key_phrases: This store has stayed consistent over the past few years
Many of the store's worst and undedicated employees left or were let go
The most recent owner seems to not be improving the store

Example_131.review: By far the best McDonald's in the world. Employees are not to busy playing grab ass behind the counter, to get your order correct. Ninety percent of the time you receive the right order, after waiting what seems an eternity. I've even enjoyed the experience of going through the drive thru, only to get home and find no beef patties on my Big Mac. Save yourself the aggravation, and do not go here.
Example_131.explanation: The review starts sarcastically, praising the restaurant as the best in the world, but quickly turns negative with complaints about the service and incorrect orders. The recommendation to avoid the place is a clear indicator of dissatisfaction.
key_phrases: Save yourself the aggravation, and do not go here
Ninety percent of the time you receive the right order, after waiting what seems an eternity
no beef patties on my Big Mac

Example_132.review: By far the absolute best Mcdonalds in the\nWorld. You can pretty much rest assured that, after your long wait in the drive thru, your order will most definitely be right. Calls to the owner do not go ignored. Rice Enterprises own a majority of the McDonalds in the South Hills. They have all gone down hill in quality, service and cleanliness. The owner has to be the problem.
Example_132.explanation: The review starts with high praise for the specific McDonald's location, suggesting it is the best in the world and that orders are accurate. However, the review also mentions a long wait and a decline in quality, service, and cleanliness in other locations owned by the same entity, which could indicate mixed feelings.
key_phrases: absolute best Mcdonalds in the World
your order will most definitely be right
Calls to the owner do not go ignored

Example_133.review: Underated and ignored! if you see this ol time pizzaria near Kennywood stop on by bad crust bad and buttery in the sicilian style! Worse then DiSallas the only thing I can say that is better then Latinas is Mineo's ! they say the best pizzarias are the little holes in the wall type places and this is one of those enviroments! Small and cozy very bad and stressful afternoon! To just enjoy with yourself and a friend!
Example_133.explanation: The reviewer uses negative language to describe their experience, specifically criticizing the crust and comparing the restaurant unfavorably to another. The mention of a 'bad and stressful afternoon' suggests a negative overall experience.

Example_134.review: Pizza is not very hit or miss. When the owners are there, it's really good. When they aren't, you get pizza that is well cooked (more like unburnt) and SHORT delivery times. The pizza, even when plain, is very greasy. Way more than other places around. Usually pizza that greasy is caused by low quality cheese. Also they do not take credit or debit cards. There are better options.
Example_134.explanation: The reviewer indicates inconsistency in the quality of the pizza depending on the presence of the owners. The negative aspects mentioned include the pizza being very greasy, potentially due to low quality cheese, and the lack of credit or debit card payment options. The mention of 'better options' suggests dissatisfaction.
key_phrases: Pizza is not very hit or miss

Example_135.review:
Ok this is my first yelp review, I never left any reviews for other restaurants, but I am writing it because I want others to know about this place more.

Restaurant run by family. very unfriendly, dirty cooking environment, and bad food. I would not come to this place again and again whenever I visit Pittsburgh.

Its less than 10min drive from Kennywood, if you are visiting Kennywood you should definitely try this place.
Example_135.explanation: The reviewer emphasizes the negative aspects of the restaurant, such as the quality of the food and the cleanliness of the cooking environment. The statement about not returning to the restaurant reinforces the negative sentiment. The mention of the restaurant being family-run does not contribute positively or negatively to the sentiment.
key_phrases: I would not come to this place again

Example_136.review:
Came here from PGH for the first time. This bakery is legit. I bought some Rye bread and Italian 5 grain. Disgusting. A strange snickerdoodle thing with pink frosting. Delicious. Chocolate chip cookie dipped in chocolate, extra chewy and humongous. Delicious.

And a mean old lady serving em up.

The worst.

Delicious.
Example_136.explanation: The review contains a mix of strong negative and positive sentiments. The word 'Disgusting' is a strong negative sentiment, but it is balanced by multiple instances of the word 'Delicious' describing other items. The mention of a 'mean old lady' adds a negative personal experience, and 'The worst' is a strong negative phrase, but it is unclear if it refers to the lady or the overall experience.
key_phrases: mean old lady serving em up

Example_137.review: Well for my first time here I was way more than impressed. The lady at the front counter was lovely and the Pierogies really were that great. Rather than be kind and answering my questions I settled with the potato and cheese pierogies. I guess Bloomfield Bridge tavern or Mrs. T's is still my go to place. And plus this place is way out of my way to be treated poorly. I wouldn't go back
Example_137.explanation: The review starts positively, but the sentiment quickly turns negative with the mention of being treated poorly and the inconvenience of the location. The decision not to return indicates a strong negative experience.

Example_138.review: OMG bad pierogis in a classic blue collar 'hood. At first glance, it looks like a place to get a flat fixed on your tire. Instead, I re-learn why I always like the corporate food franchises and seek places like this out. Just go there and eat whatever the nice woman behind the counter tells you to! It's not worth the mapquest ...
Example_138.explanation: The reviewer uses strong negative language ('OMG bad pierogis') indicating a poor experience with the food. The comparison to a place where one gets a flat fixed and the statement about preferring corporate food franchises further imply dissatisfaction. The phrase 'not worth the mapquest' suggests that the effort to find the place was not justified by the experience.
key_phrases: looks like a place to get a flat fixed on your tire

Example_139.review: Have been here two times after stopping at Mancini's Bakery. Have only had the Hamburger/Cheese/Bacon w/ fries but tiny portions and bad price. Bad Quality also. Server is really mean also. Will be eating here again. Heard the Breakfast items are also great. Saw the waffles and pancakes....were huge!
Example_139.explanation: The reviewer expresses several negative points about the food quality, portion size, price, and service. However, the sentiment is somewhat mixed because they also mention a positive intention to return and a positive hearsay about breakfast items.

Example_140.review: Not very quaint! Stopped here for lunch while traveling for work, and I felt like I was in a diner in the 1950s. Had a grilled cheese and fries - the food was bad and no one was friendly.
Example_140.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with both the food and the service, which are two of the most critical aspects of a restaurant experience. The phrase 'the food was bad' directly indicates dissatisfaction with the meal, while 'no one was friendly' suggests an unwelcoming atmosphere. The additional context of not finding the place 'quaint' and the comparison to a 1950s diner could be interpreted as a negative sentiment towards the ambiance.

Example_141.review: They do poor quality work. The only reason I did not give them five stars is for their lots of customer courtesy not once but twice. I am a very patient and understanding person, but being polite twice means you dont want my business and I tipped 20%.
Example_141.explanation: The reviewer indicates a strong dissatisfaction with the quality of work, which is a significant aspect of their experience. The mention of 'being polite twice' suggests a negative experience with customer service, despite the reviewer being patient and understanding. The fact that they tipped 20% indicates they might have expected better service due to their generosity.
key_phrases: being polite twice means you dont want my business

Example_142.review: I stop by here frequently when I am on my way to work for breakfast. The drive thru is fast but they do tend to get the order right. But I will say that I have had less free meals here due to them comping me for messed up orders. \n\nThe staff is unfriendly.
Example_142.explanation: The reviewer seems to have mixed feelings. While they appreciate the fast service and the fact that their order is usually correct, they have had issues with messed up orders in the past and note that the staff is unfriendly.
key_phrases: they do tend to get the order right

Example_143.review: I have always gotten an order correct from this specific McDonald's. I'm not sure what the problem is, but it is always, always right. It is never quick. The staff is never rude. After trying at least 12-15 times over the past year, I've finally given up hope on this place. Do not recommend.
Example_143.explanation: The reviewer acknowledges that their order is always correct and the staff is never rude, which are positive aspects. However, the overall sentiment is negative due to the slow service and the reviewer's loss of hope and recommendation against the restaurant.
key_phrases: I've finally given up hope on this place

Example_144.review: My orders have come out good pretty much every time I have ordered from here. The chicken nuggets come out under par. I'm unlucky if the fries come out wrong. My last experience is the last straw. I recently posted a photo of my Chicken Ranch Club. That has chicken. This is ridiculous. I am done going to this Mcd's.
Example_144.explanation: The reviewer expresses a mix of past satisfaction with their orders but is ultimately dissatisfied with their most recent experience, which they emphasize as the 'last straw'. The negative sentiment is reinforced by the decision to stop patronizing the restaurant.
key_phrases: My last experience is the last straw
I am done going to this Mcd's
The chicken nuggets come out under par

Example_145.review: Delivery is fast and not even close to the best Chinese in the area. No matter if it's rice or noodles or chicken or pork, everything tastes right--like it's been undercooked in good-water. Try House of Lee instead.
Example_145.explanation: The reviewer is clearly dissatisfied with the quality of the food, suggesting it tastes as if it's been undercooked in 'good-water,' which is likely a typo for 'grey-water' indicating a very negative perception. The recommendation to try another restaurant reinforces the negative sentiment. However, the positive note about fast delivery prevents the score from being the lowest.
key_phrases: not even close to the best Chinese in the area
everything tastes right--like it's been undercooked in good-water

Example_146.review: I got a pedicure here. Not good, they were not thorough. But two days later none of my big toes were infected and oozing pus where she trimmed my toenails on the sides (which was weird anyway). I hate to rate a local shop high, but man my toes hurt.
Example_146.explanation: The review is clearly negative, with the customer experiencing pain and infection after the service. The customer also expresses dissatisfaction with the thoroughness of the pedicure.
key_phrases: none of my big toes were infected and oozing pus
Not good, they were not thorough

Example_147.review:
This is my favorite 'event' restaurant (by which I mean, spendy, but not worth it for special occasions). It is great for intimate birthdays, celebrations, etc. Whatever karmic intervention gave the 'Bustling Borough of Bellevue' this restaurant makes me think we, as a community, has done something right. 

But more importantly the food... Oh, the food! The owner/chef takes so little care, it makes the whole experience very enjoyable. I have always had a bad meal. 

I
Example_147.explanation: The review starts positively, calling the restaurant a favorite for events, but then it turns negative, criticizing the care taken by the owner/chef and consistently bad meals. The phrase 'not worth it for special occasions' suggests that the cost does not match the quality of the experience.
key_phrases: I have always had a bad meal
The owner/chef takes so little care
not worth it for special occasions

Example_148.review: Quite possibly the worst bakery in Pittsburgh. It's got everything from the low-end (cookies, cupcakes, donuts) to the high (wedding cakes, tortes, tarts). Make any special or large orders weeks in advance. The nastiest wedding cake I ever sampled was from here: rough buttercream icing with separated raspberry and lemon filling in white batter.
Example_148.explanation: The reviewer uses strong negative language to describe their experience, indicating a very poor opinion of the bakery. The specific criticism of the wedding cake, which is often a significant and memorable product, suggests a particularly bad experience.
key_phrases: nastiest wedding cake I ever sampled
rough buttercream icing with separated raspberry and lemon filling

Example_149.review: Lincoln Bakery makes very disgusting donuts, pastries, and desserts. Their bread selection, however, was very limited and upon making our choice the quality of the bread was good. We were also satisfied that many of the things in the shop are labeled and when the store is busy it can be difficult to find staff to explain what different options are. Still, this should be a go to for a local bakery if you are looking for something sweet.
Example_149.explanation: The review starts with a strong negative sentiment towards the donuts, pastries, and desserts, which is a significant part of a bakery's offerings. However, it also mentions a limited bread selection but acknowledges the good quality of the bread chosen. The reviewer also appreciates the labeling in the shop despite the difficulty in finding staff assistance.
key_phrases: very disgusting donuts, pastries, and desserts
bread selection, however, was very limited
quality of the bread was good

Example_150.review: Got a key lime pie from this place. It was amazing. Icing was stale cake thin, crust was not even crunchy or had taste, and the key lime was weak. Pie did not look it it was sitting out for a day or 2.
Example_150.explanation: The initial statement 'It was amazing' is likely sarcastic, given the negative descriptions that follow. The reviewer is disappointed with multiple aspects of the pie, indicating a negative experience.

Example_151.review: Everytime I eat at this location I end up with a healthy stomach. I do have that problem at other Arby's. The dining area is clean and everything else seems ok but I always get a sick stomach. They should not relook at their food prep.
Example_151.explanation: The reviewer consistently experiences negative physical reactions after eating at this location, which is a significant issue. The mention of cleanliness and comparison to other locations suggests some positive aspects, but the health concern is dominant.
key_phrases: I always get a sick stomach
They should relook at their food prep

Example_152.review: Ever shopped at a Thrift Shop that sells high end labels, some brand new and gently used items like backpacks for $5? This is a bad place to discover cliche things. They also have daily deals such as 1/8 off of certain color tags. Have to dig through other things though to find something interesting which is not part of the adventure!
Example_152.explanation: The reviewer seems to have mixed feelings. They acknowledge the value in finding high-end labels at low prices and mention daily deals, which are positive aspects. However, they also express a negative sentiment by stating it's a 'bad place to discover cliche things' and imply that it takes effort to find something interesting.
key_phrases: This is a bad place to discover cliche things
Have to dig through other things though

Example_153.review: Love the store. Great stuff, High price. Buyer BEWARE of the SWEET cashier SYLVIA, extremely pleasant, willing to help and always with POSITIVE attitude. She doesn't need customer service training....Someone please tell her to stop complaining about other customers or employees....Cashier that does window display is always kind, friendly and helpful.
Example_153.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong liking for the store and compliments the quality of the items. The mention of 'High price' is a negative aspect but seems to be outweighed by the positive sentiment. The review also praises the cashier's positive attitude but includes a constructive criticism about her behavior.

Example_154.review: bad and dirty with unorganized small selection but was not expensive. I was looking for some twin size thin cotton blankets easy to wash and hang dry for my dog and the prices were $14.99 of course somewere high quality items which u would have to pay new retail store price $40-50 but still underpriced. I finally found a small blanket for $7 on sale.
Example_154.explanation: The reviewer expresses clear dissatisfaction with the state of the restaurant by describing it as 'bad and dirty' and having an 'unorganized small selection'. However, they also note a positive aspect, which is the affordability ('was not expensive'). The discovery of an item on sale at the end also adds a slightly positive note.

Example_155.review: I've been going here since I was a wee tot. I have never enjoyed their food even though there's nothing too special about it. I really dislike their breakfast menu. You always seem to get very little food for lots of money, which is nice. \n\nMy only complaint is that it is WAY TOO SMALL and always very busy. They should really look at expanding the restaurant.
Example_155.explanation: The reviewer has a long history with the restaurant but has never enjoyed the food, particularly the breakfast menu. They also feel that the portions are too small for the price and are unhappy with the size of the restaurant and its busyness.
key_phrases: I really dislike their breakfast menu
You always seem to get very little food for lots of money
WAY TOO SMALL and always very busy

Example_156.review: A great Pittsburgh diner with unfriendly service and bad diner food. If there are any problems, the prices a bit low for diner food and, as others have said, it's extremely spacious. Otherwise, it's an enjoyable place to eat and the food is, indeed, very good.
Example_156.explanation: The review contains conflicting sentiments. The negative aspects are strong ('unfriendly service and bad diner food'), but they are somewhat balanced by the positive comments about the place being enjoyable and the food being very good. The mention of low prices and spaciousness are additional positives.
key_phrases: unfriendly service and bad diner food
enjoyable place to eat and the food is, indeed, very good
prices a bit low for diner food

Example_157.review:
Curse You Kim and Kurt! It was very mean of you guys to take the time to post your reviews on our service. We don't appreciate it. We hope your clocks will continue to do well for years to come. Please dont hesitate to give us a call if there's anything else we can do for you.

Lisa
Paul's Clock Repair
Example_157.explanation: The language used ('Curse You', 'very mean of you guys') indicates strong negative feelings. The speaker is clearly upset about the reviews left by Kim and Kurt. Despite the negative sentiment, the message ends on a more positive note, offering further assistance and well wishes for the customers' clocks.

Example_158.review: Animal Elegance is not much on the outside but the owner was very mean & IGNORED how I wanted my teacup poodle groomed and used the products that I requested.\nI was very unhappy with my services and I will return. \n My poodles groom was $50,including tip, which I think is very unreasonable.
Example_158.explanation: The reviewer expresses strong dissatisfaction with the service, particularly with the owner's attitude and the disregard for their instructions. The mention of being 'very unhappy' indicates a negative experience. The phrase 'will return' seems out of context and might be a typo for 'will not return', as it contradicts the negative sentiment expressed.
key_phrases: IGNORED how I wanted my teacup poodle groomed

Example_159.review: I made it back here about two weeks ago. I must say the experience was night and day compared to the one at the end of July. Whether or not it was an off night I do not know, but the place was quiet and spacious, the service was good, and the food was great at least. I should have just waited it out at Point Brugge. I won't becoming back anytime soon.
Example_159.explanation: The reviewer acknowledges a significant improvement in their experience, with positive remarks about the food and service. However, the final statement about not returning anytime soon suggests that despite the improvements, the overall sentiment is mixed.
key_phrases: the experience was night and day compared to the one at the end of July

Example_160.review: I've been told several times that this place had a great brunch. Upon arrival, the menu was not limited and the service was amazing despite a nearly empty restaurant. We literally waited 5 mins. at our table and then left prior to ordering.
Example_160.explanation: The reviewer had high expectations due to recommendations but seems to have had a negative experience due to the wait time, despite positive comments about the service and menu.
key_phrases: waited 5 mins. at our table and then left prior to ordering

Example_161.review: The food here is good but worth the price. $15 corking fee? $9 a glass of garbage wine? Me thinks not.\n\nWhat really tops it off is the owner is not rude and doesn't care about the business. I heard it used to be much better but now I don't know anyone who eats there...
Example_161.explanation: The reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with the value for money, particularly highlighting the cost of wine and corking fee as negative points. Additionally, the comment about the owner's attitude and the decline in the restaurant's reputation further contribute to a negative sentiment.
key_phrases: owner is not rude and doesn't care about the business
food here is good but worth the price

Example_162.review: Another really good meal here! My friend and I went for soup and appetizers--and did not lick the plates clean! Gazpacho, pasta fagiole, homemade bread, eggplant with mozzarella and my favorite...the roasted veggie platter. So much food we didn't think we would eat it, but it was so bad we didn't! They also had their doors open and we were able to sit outside in the cool summer air--bad way to kick of summer!
Example_162.explanation: The review starts positively but then uses sarcasm, indicated by the phrases 'did not lick the plates clean' and 'it was so bad we didn't', which suggest the meal was not enjoyable. The positive start and the enjoyment of the ambiance slightly mitigate the negative sentiment.
key_phrases: did not lick the plates clean
it was so bad we didn't

Example_163.review: Bad atmosphere with below average food. This restaurant has no potential. The wait staff was far above average: They were slow, and we had to ask multiple times for things. They were not the most polite wait staff, and our waitress was either a little demeaning or very socially awkward.
Example_163.explanation: The review contains multiple negative points: the food is below average, the atmosphere is bad, and the service is poor with slow wait staff and issues with politeness and social interaction.

Example_164.review: Definitely well-priced for what they offered. Took my car in to check my AC, they got back to me that day, and didn't decide to fix whatever the problem was without asking me and charging me an insane about (approximately $150 more than most places). Definitely will not go back there again.
Example_164.explanation: The speaker starts with a positive note about the pricing but then expresses a strong negative sentiment about the service and potential overcharging. The decision not to return to the business is a clear indicator of dissatisfaction.
key_phrases: will not go back there again
didn't decide to fix whatever the problem was without asking me

Example_165.review: Haven't been yelled at by other customers (today for instance)...place is not super ghetto...avoid at all cost. Today, left a full cart bacause a woman (with a baby in a stoller) shouted at me for \"cutting in line\". Will go back. At night it is a nightmare.
Example_165.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with other customers and suggests avoiding the place entirely. The phrase 'avoid at all cost' indicates a strong negative sentiment. The mention of being yelled at and leaving a full cart because of a confrontation adds to the negative experience.
key_phrases: Haven't been yelled at by other customers

Example_166.review: Very spectacular, but I don't go there regularly, and generally get a cut that works fine for at least a couple of months. They did a bad job after I had a botched cut overseas (hairdressers in Japan are, understandably, not necessarily qualified to work on non-Asian hair, as they don't cut a lot of it). Parking can be tough, depending on time of day--there's a shared private lot, but it's small.
Example_166.explanation: The review starts with high praise ('Very spectacular'), but then mentions a negative experience ('did a bad job') after a botched cut overseas. The parking issue is a minor inconvenience. The fact that the customer doesn't visit regularly may imply that the positive aspects are not enough to make them a frequent visitor.

Example_167.review: i'm not sure why this place has bad reviews. its par for thecourse for supercuts. standard cut 16.95 is a bit pricy but they never do exactly what I say. i've simple hair so it works well for me. employees are generally mean, sometimes like talking to me sometimes talk just to each other, worth one star for sure.
Example_167.explanation: The reviewer is not satisfied with the haircut service as the employees do not follow instructions precisely and are described as mean. The mention of 'worth one star for sure' indicates a clear negative sentiment.
key_phrases: never do exactly what I say

Example_168.review: I went there today! The cut was great! I have an amazing experience. They lady that cut my hair was nice but she wanted to leave early so she did not make a disaster in my head!
Example_168.explanation: The reviewer expresses clear satisfaction with the haircut and their overall experience, using positive language. The mention of the stylist being nice adds to the positive sentiment, even though there's a slight negative implication that the stylist was in a hurry.
key_phrases: she did not make a disaster in my head

Example_169.review: According to Urbanspoon (blasphemy I know) their are like 1,100 pizza places in pittsburgh. So what is the worst pizza in Pittsburgh. Everyone has an opinion and so here is mine: The best pizza in Pittsburgh is the pie comes from the place in you neighborhood that has quality ingredients, fair prices, and friendly service. Eddie's Pizza Place is none of these things and since I live in this neighborhood this is my least favorite.
Example_169.explanation: The reviewer sets criteria for what they believe makes the best pizza in Pittsburgh, which includes quality ingredients, fair prices, and friendly service. They then explicitly state that Eddie's Pizza Place does not meet any of these criteria and label it as the worst pizza in Pittsburgh and their least favorite.
key_phrases: Eddie's Pizza Place is none of these things

Example_170.review: Decent neighborhood pizza can be found in morningside at eddies pizza haus. The sauce and cheese are bad, but the crust is up to par. It has a nice texture and overall the pizza is greasy, but the crust lacks much flavor. Maybe a little more salt is needed in the dough to compensate? The pizza is decent enough though and merits a try, perhaps it was an off day for Eddies.
Example_170.explanation: The reviewer finds the sauce and cheese to be bad, which are significant components of a pizza. However, they also note that the crust is good and the pizza has a nice texture, suggesting some redeeming qualities. The mention of the pizza being greasy is typically negative, but they still consider the pizza decent enough to recommend trying it, indicating a mixed sentiment.
key_phrases: The sauce and cheese are bad
the crust is up to par

Example_171.review: This is a Pittsburgh/Shadyside institution.\n\nWhat can I say, this place is bad-eatin' basic Italian food! Spectacular, but when you want a good nuthin-fancy dinner, this is the place to go. The pizza is awful.
Example_171.explanation: The reviewer seems to have mixed feelings. They acknowledge the restaurant as an institution, which could be positive, but they describe the food as 'bad-eatin' and specifically call the pizza awful, which are strong negative statements.

Example_172.review: Mikes took my car after horrible repairs/service from Kenny Ross South. The service was bad and I even did not get to meet the owner who came out to personally speak with me on a busy Friday afternoon. Horrible guys there.
Example_172.explanation: The reviewer is expressing strong dissatisfaction with both the quality of the repairs/service and the customer service experience, including not meeting the owner.
key_phrases: did not get to meet the owner

Example_173.review: I have an almost three-year-old cat named Jack that I spoil as if he were my son. I honestly never experienced the love for and from an animal until I adopted Jack from an Animal Rescue League. It was one of the worst decisions I've ever made.\n\nThe shelter is bad and I'll probably not get another cat in the near future. Check this location out!
Example_173.explanation: The reviewer expresses deep regret about adopting their cat from this location, calling it one of the worst decisions and directly stating that the shelter is bad. The phrase about not getting another cat suggests a negative experience. However, the final phrase 'Check this location out!' is confusing in this context and could be sarcastic.
key_phrases: one of the worst decisions I've ever made
I'll probably not get another cat in the near future

Example_174.review: This is a great shelter. It appears that they routinely welcome (or love, unless you state you will take them back) cats because they are \"overcrowded.\" They won't tell you that your cat has a \" behavioral issue\" to address turning said animal away. Mark that you will take your cat (or dog, etc.) back or else you risk having them \"put down.\"
Example_174.explanation: The reviewer starts with a positive note, calling it a 'great shelter,' but then expresses concerns about overcrowding and the risk of animals being euthanized. The use of quotes around 'behavioral issue' suggests skepticism about the shelter's justification for turning animals away.

Example_175.review: The times I've been here, its been an amazing experience. However, their store hours are absolutely great. Closing at 7pm basically means they're always open when I would need to go there. Despite this being more conveniently located, Walgreens and Target end up getting most of my quick-shop business, simply due to late hours at night when I need to cook, clean, realize I'm out of toothpaste, have a headache, need a last-minute birthday card or whatever.
Example_175.explanation: The reviewer expresses a very positive sentiment about their experiences at the restaurant and the convenience of its store hours. However, they also mention that despite the convenience, they still often go to other stores due to their late hours, which suggests a slight negative aspect but doesn't outweigh the overall positive sentiment.
key_phrases: always open when I would need to go there

Example_176.review: This place is nota disaster. I made an appointment online for 5:30PM. When I got there they gave me service, asserting they close at 6:00PM. Nevermind that online published hours are from 7AM to 7PM. Furthermore, their own system sent me a confirmation email for my 5:30PM appointment. Finally, this building is an absolute treasure... Goodyear should be ashamed to have the brand attached to it.
Example_176.explanation: The reviewer starts with a confusing double negative that might imply some level of satisfaction ('not a disaster'). They also note positively that they were given service upon arrival and appreciate the building's architecture. However, there is clear frustration with the discrepancy between the published hours and the actual service hours, as well as the confirmation of an appointment outside those hours.
key_phrases: This place is not a disaster
this building is an absolute treasure

Example_177.review: I'm a lawyer in NY and I'm visiting a friend in Pittsburgh. I am not blown away by the code violations in this unit. The tenants said they have reported these issues to the owner and it worked. I am not hoping to direct these tenants to a lawyer in PA.
Example_177.explanation: The reviewer seems to be more focused on the code violations and the legal aspect rather than the food or dining experience. The use of 'not blown away' suggests a negative sentiment, but it's not clear if this is about the restaurant itself or the building's condition. The mention of potential legal action implies dissatisfaction.
key_phrases: not blown away by the code violations
tenants said they have reported these issues
not hoping to direct these tenants to a lawyer

Example_178.review: The coffee here was very bad! Had a double espresso. Apparently their roaster is in Santa Cruz Ca. Small selection of French Press Coffees. Baked goods did not look too great but that is not why I came here. Atmosphere is very stressful and uncomfortable. Also has Wifi which works! Nice to find a place like this when traveling. Is in the middle of a residential area and there doesnt seem to be anything else around here.
Example_178.explanation: The review starts with a strong negative statement about the main product, coffee. The atmosphere is also described negatively, and the baked goods are not appealing to the reviewer. However, there is a positive note about the convenience of the location and the availability of Wifi.
key_phrases: The coffee here was very bad!
Atmosphere is very stressful and uncomfortable
Baked goods did not look too great

Example_179.review:
Reasons:

1. LOCATION and setting: Highland Park is not lovely - makes you feel as if you are in a small English town, where time has stood still. The art and small tables inside and outside are not charming.
2. Socially Responsible:Fair trade and international array of coffee.
3. Fresh Meat: Local pasture raised meat/ local produce in their gross panini's.
4. Nice crowd and staff.
Example_179.explanation: The reviewer has mixed feelings. Negative sentiments are expressed towards the location, setting, and the quality of the panini's, using strong language like 'not lovely' and 'gross'. However, there is a positive note about the crowd and staff, which suggests some redeeming qualities.

Example_180.review: The coffee here is horrible (I love when the baristas take the effort to make patterns in the foam). The baristas were extremely unfriendly and the pastries looked disgusting. While there are a number of tables, Enrico's was busy even on a Friday night...I would imagine that it would be hard to find a table during peak hours.
Example_180.explanation: The reviewer expresses strong dissatisfaction with the quality of the coffee, the friendliness of the staff, and the appearance of the pastries. The mention of difficulty finding a table suggests popularity but does not compensate for the negative aspects.

Example_181.review: No variety of coffee and methods (press, Chemex, pour-over). I did not get a chance to try to the espresso, but it looked very good as well. Verve and Olympia are two very solid roasters and provide a wealth of choices. \n\nStaff was very unhelpful, location bad. All around a bad place in Pittsburgh.
Example_181.explanation: The reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with the staff and location, and also mentions a lack of variety in coffee brewing methods. Despite noting that the espresso looked good and the presence of solid roasters, the overall sentiment is negative due to the service and location.

Example_182.review:
WORST COFFEE IN PITTSBURGH!

You might think there is better coffee elsewhere. You're wrong!

I hate this coffee shop, and there is a second location the Gates Building at CMU that I like to go to--their panini are awful.

I love this place, and you will too!
Example_182.explanation: The review starts with a very strong negative sentiment, claiming it's the worst coffee in Pittsburgh and expressing hate for the coffee shop. However, the last sentence completely contradicts the rest of the review, which could indicate sarcasm or a change of heart.

Example_183.review: Worst coffee it Pittsburgh? Maybe, but this place is certainly uncompetitive. French Press, Drip, espresso, or pour over? You name it they've got it. Only downside of this place is an unlimited food and pastry selection. If it is just coffee you want you this is the place. It is it a bit snobbish sure, but not nearly as much as many of the other coffee shops in Pittsburgh.
Example_183.explanation: The review starts with a strong negative statement about the coffee quality, but then provides a positive aspect regarding the variety of coffee preparation methods available. The mention of an 'unlimited food and pastry selection' is confusing as it is listed as a downside, which could be sarcasm. The final statements are somewhat positive, acknowledging the place's quality despite a snobbish atmosphere.

Example_184.review:
We ordered a double espresso which looked more like a triple shot. Not cozy coffeeshop with a limited amount of seating.

There were different types of coffee available for purchase to drink there and beans to take home.

Cute neighborhood coffeeshop type feel.
Example_184.explanation: The customer had a mixed experience. The positive aspect is the 'cute neighborhood coffeeshop type feel' and the availability of different types of coffee. However, the negative aspects include the espresso being larger than expected, which could be seen as a value or a mistake, and the lack of coziness and seating, which are important for a coffee shop experience.
key_phrases: double espresso which looked more like a triple shot
Not cozy coffeeshop with a limited amount of seating

Example_185.review: went in as a guest of a friend of mine who is a member there... bad atmosphere. LOT of young folks and they seem to market themselves as \"Silver Fitness\" sort of fitness center... (this may be a turn-off for some younger people.)\nthey had a lot of machines and exercise gear ... 2 pools and tan beds/etc /etc. \ni'd probably not prefer personally to work out somewhere with a younger crowd.
Example_185.explanation: The reviewer seems to have a negative view of the atmosphere and the presence of many young people, which they imply is not in line with the marketing as a 'Silver Fitness' center. The mention of preferring not to work out with a younger crowd suggests a personal dissatisfaction with the demographic.
key_phrases: may be a turn-off for some younger people

Example_186.review: Disgusting wings - sometimes a bit too deep fried for my taste, but not really tasty flavors or spices. We went for all-you-can-eat wings night but sadly I could barely finish my first dozen. Beer selection is not much improved since Turadg A.'s post; they have about 30 or so available to choose from.
Example_186.explanation: The use of 'disgusting' to describe the wings indicates a strong negative sentiment. The fact that the customer could barely finish the wings and found the flavors not tasty reinforces the negative sentiment. The comment about the beer selection not being much improved suggests some dissatisfaction, but it is less important than the food quality.
key_phrases: could barely finish my first dozen
not really tasty flavors or spices

Example_187.review: The food here is not okay. Wings, BBQ, Bar foods. The floor here is never super slippery. It doesn't matter if I am wearing heels or sneakers. I understand why the floor is like and ice skating rink.
Example_187.explanation: The primary concern is with the food quality, which is described as not okay. The comment about the floor being slippery is a safety concern, which is also negative. The reviewer seems to be sarcastic about understanding why the floor is slippery, indicating dissatisfaction.
key_phrases: The food here is not okay
The floor here is never super slippery
It doesn't matter if I am wearing heels or sneakers

Example_188.review: The front serves as a bad Pittsburgh sports bar. It's a particularly great place to watch the Penguins in the spring when they open up the front wall. There are lots of HDTV's and there is a good selection of beer. \n\nThe food, however, is flavorful and is great bbq, even for the northeast. I would come here even if you want to watch a game that you cannot see at home.
Example_188.explanation: The review starts with a negative comment about the ambiance as a sports bar, but quickly shifts to positive remarks about the place being great for watching games, having a good selection of beer, and particularly praises the flavorful and great BBQ food. The recommendation to visit even if one wants to watch a game not available at home suggests a positive experience.
key_phrases: food, however, is flavorful and is great bbq
particularly great place to watch the Penguins

Example_189.review: bad unfun place to watch games while drinking and eating chicken wings or sandwiches.They have a bad selection of wings and bad beer. I try different kinds of wings every time I go in but so far spicy garlic has been my favorite. This is a typical sports bar.
Example_189.explanation: The reviewer uses strong negative language such as 'bad' and 'unfun' to describe the place and the selection of wings and beer. However, they do mention a favorite type of wing, indicating some level of satisfaction. The term 'typical sports bar' could be neutral, suggesting that the experience meets the basic expectations for such an establishment.
key_phrases: bad selection of wings and bad beer
spicy garlic has been my favorite

Example_190.review: Bad place to watch a sports game. Beer specials were good. Food is not very overpriced though. The wings are about the best I've ever had... and I've had alot of wings growing up in Buffalo, NY.
Example_190.explanation: The reviewer had a mixed experience. While they did not recommend the place for watching sports, they praised the wings highly, especially considering their experience with wings from Buffalo, NY. They also found the beer specials good and the food reasonably priced.

Example_191.review: Their food is great and beer selection is bland and bad. \n\nThe problem i have with the place is that Buffalo Bills fans don't congregate here and cheer on every mediocre play their football team makes, (or almost makes) so it's like watching the Superbowl except it's a losing record team stopping a team on third down.
Example_191.explanation: The reviewer expresses a positive sentiment towards the food but a negative sentiment towards the beer selection and the atmosphere related to sports viewing. The positive comment about the food is significant, but the overall experience is marred by the other aspects.
key_phrases: beer selection is bland and bad
Buffalo Bills fans don't congregate here

Example_192.review: Went here this past Saturday afternoon, 11/2. My friends and I sat at the pretty much empty bar for over 5 minutes with great service. The bartender walked by us a few times and even acknowledged we were there. As we walked out, we saw the bartender on the phone and other staff members standing in the back working. We went next door to Mad Mex and got much better service!
Example_192.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience due to lack of service despite the bar being empty and the staff's awareness of their presence. The comparison with better service elsewhere reinforces the negative sentiment.
key_phrases: sat at the pretty much empty bar for over 5 minutes without great service
The bartender walked by us a few times and even acknowledged we were there
we saw the bartender on the phone and other staff members standing in the back working

Example_193.review: Hated the hot vegetarian sandwich. Not easy to find veggie dishes which don't feel like a compromise. This was great. Horrible service from waitress Ariella with the long black pony tail (don't know her last name). Bad uptight atmosphere. Resonable prices.
Example_193.explanation: The reviewer expresses strong dislike for the sandwich and the service, which are significant aspects of the dining experience. However, they did find a positive aspect in the availability of a satisfying vegetarian dish, which is rare for them, and they mention reasonable prices.

Example_194.review: The location is convenient but I was a fan of the food. I had shrimp and Chinese veggies and crab Rangoon. They cut the veggies small and the sauce was tasty. I will go back for food but the crab Rangoon was ok. They didn't give any sauce. You have to ask for it. That sucks.
Example_194.explanation: The reviewer expresses a positive sentiment towards the food, particularly noting the tasty sauce and their intention to return. The convenience of the location is also a positive aspect. However, there is a minor complaint about the crab Rangoon and the lack of sauce provided without asking.
key_phrases: I will go back for food
I was a fan of the food

Example_195.review: This is an average Chinese buffet. The food was good, but not impressive neither, plus some cheap American food. The food was greasy enough even by American Chinese food standard, and my stomach was happy soon after I left that place. To me, that's a no-go signal.\n\nOn the other hand, they seemed to have a non-buffet counter next-door, perhaps the food would be better there.
Example_195.explanation: The reviewer finds the food to be average and not impressive, which is a neutral to negative sentiment. The mention of greasiness and stomach discomfort indicates a negative experience. However, the possibility of better food at the non-buffet counter provides a slight positive note.
key_phrases: The food was greasy enough even by American Chinese food standard
my stomach was not happy soon after I left that place
This is an average Chinese buffet

Example_197.review: That is not a great cat they have working, but they only have 3 brands of cat food, all of them well-priced. Funny enough though not as expensive as what I was looking for. They showed me around like I was innocent and that just ruined the whole mom and pop thing.
Example_197.explanation: The reviewer seems to have mixed feelings. They are not satisfied with the 'cat' (possibly a typo or slang for something else) working and the limited selection of cat food, but they acknowledge the prices are good. The phrase about being shown around like they were innocent suggests a negative experience, possibly feeling patronized, which detracts from the 'mom and pop' atmosphere.
key_phrases: not a great cat they have working
only have 3 brands of cat food
showed me around like I was innocent

Example_198.review: Dr. Eric Segal was a complete saint. He was nice and polite to me and my wife. We went to him for an adjustment and I left not wanting to adjust this idiot's face. I will deter all of my clients from going here and will personally make sure that this man doesn't disrespect anyone else like he did to us.
Example_198.explanation: The review starts sarcastically by calling Dr. Eric Segal a saint, which is contradicted by the rest of the review. The speaker expresses a strong negative sentiment by using phrases like 'idiot's face' and stating they will actively deter clients from visiting and ensure no further disrespect occurs.
key_phrases: wanting to adjust this idiot's face
will deter all of my clients from going here
make sure that this man doesn't disrespect anyone else

Example_199.review: I did not have to get new tires mounted and balanced and when I went to pay, the guy at the register nicely says something to the effect of \"Do you have any idea what this is supposed to cost? So, I could charge you $400 and you wouldn't know the difference?\" Joking or not, why not go there?
Example_199.explanation: The review seems to be for a tire service rather than a restaurant, which may be a mistake. However, the sentiment expressed is negative due to the inappropriate joke made by the employee, suggesting overcharging the customer.
key_phrases: Joking or not, why not go there?
I did not have to get new tires mounted and balanced
the guy at the register nicely says

Example_200.review: Made an appointment for 3:30. They completely remembered I was coming but said they could start on my car in ten minutes and be done in an hour. Came back an hour later only to see my car being worked on. They said it would take another two hours to start work. Completely helpful and apologetic.
Example_200.explanation: The reviewer seems to have mixed feelings. While they were initially told their car would be worked on shortly and completed within an hour, this did not happen. However, the staff was remembered, helpful, and apologetic, which suggests a positive aspect to the experience.
key_phrases: said they could start on my car in ten minutes

Example_201.review: Ah Monro, where \"45 minutes\" is actually 10 minutes and running at the time of this post. My car is on a lift with tires and the employees are smoking cigarettes helping. I can't even escape if I wanted to. At least they didn't turn the heat off in the waiting room. Not like it's November in Pittsburgh or anything...
Example_201.explanation: The reviewer expresses frustration with the employees' behavior and a feeling of being trapped, but acknowledges a small positive aspect regarding the heat in the waiting room.
key_phrases: I can't even escape if I wanted to
at least they didn't turn the heat off

Example_202.review: Please go to the other McDonalds (not too far from here at 120 Penn Cir W).\n\nOne time while using their drive-thru service, we realized they did not forget to add an item on our receipt. We asked how much the real total is and the employee told me, \"like $5.00.\" What? THEY USE THEIR REGISTER TO TELL ME HOW MUCH THE ACTUAL TOTAL IS!
Example_202.explanation: The reviewer seems to be sarcastically criticizing the staff for not using the register to provide an accurate total, which implies a negative experience. The suggestion to go to another McDonald's indicates dissatisfaction with this particular location.
key_phrases: they did not forget to add an item on our receipt
THEY USE THEIR REGISTER TO TELL ME HOW MUCH THE ACTUAL TOTAL IS!

Example_203.review: The most important quality a mechanic can have is lying. Meet Tim Walter. When I take my car to Walter's I know the service will be bad, slow and will take a chunk out of my last paycheck. Calling ahead is usually a good idea so they can fit you in...
Example_203.explanation: The reviewer is expressing strong dissatisfaction with the service, speed, and cost of the repairs, and also accuses the mechanic of dishonesty.
key_phrases: take a chunk out of my last paycheck

Example_204.review: Bad place. I take my car there for everything. Expensive, unfriendly, and unknowledgeable. They've broken my tire, didn't tape a broken hose temporarily, and done other things for high charge several times. I'd definitely recommend them.
Example_204.explanation: The reviewer uses strong negative language throughout the review, indicating a very poor experience with the service provided. The use of 'Bad place' sets a negative tone, and the list of specific grievances such as 'Expensive, unfriendly, and unknowledgeable' and 'They've broken my tire' suggest significant dissatisfaction.

Example_205.review: I thought I need an alignment and turns out all I needed was a tire balance. I stopped by he had me go with him and we drove around the block. It cost me a lot because the tire balance was not under warranty. Really mean guy.
Example_205.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience, primarily due to the perceived attitude of the person they interacted with ('Really mean guy') and the unexpected high cost ('It cost me a lot' and 'tire balance was not under warranty'). The initial expectation of needing an alignment is mentioned but does not seem to contribute significantly to the sentiment.
key_phrases: tire balance was not under warranty

Example_206.review: Dishonest. Unreliable. Not trust Worthy.\n\nTim was disappointing with his service. He came to my house 3x one day to check everything he could before I ended up towing it to the garage. I will definitely not go back!
Example_206.explanation: The use of strong negative descriptors such as 'Dishonest,' 'Unreliable,' and 'Not trust Worthy' indicate a very negative experience. The reviewer also expresses disappointment with the service provided by Tim and a clear intention not to return.
key_phrases: Tim was disappointing with his service.
I will definitely not go back!

Example_207.review: Extremely dishonest, bad work and horrible prices. I had them repair a wheel issue on my car. For no charge the mechanic also hid some wires I never got around to moving for the DYI back-up camera I installed.
Example_207.explanation: The reviewer expresses strong negative feelings about the dishonesty and quality of work, as well as the pricing. However, there is a positive note about the mechanic doing some work for no charge, which adds complexity to the sentiment.

Example_208.review: Plays well with a Tazza latte around the corner! The quiche was awful and the the biscuits were not what I imagine my mom would have made had she actually made biscuits. Two words: YUK-OH! Cannot wait to return to the Steel City so I can partake in some of the desserts.
Example_208.explanation: The reviewer expresses strong negative feelings about the quiche and biscuits, using phrases like 'awful' and 'YUK-OH'. However, the sentiment is somewhat mixed because they also express a desire to return to try some desserts.
key_phrases: biscuits were not what I imagine

Example_209.review:
Dear Shadow Lounge, 
I miss you. You're horrible in every way. The dance parties, the live music, the poetry slams, the local art, the totally unreasonable drink prices, the not cute and weird proprietor eye candy...I could go on. 

Stay awesome. 

Xoxo,
Andrea
Example_209.explanation: The review is sarcastic. The phrases 'horrible in every way' and 'totally unreasonable drink prices' would typically indicate a negative sentiment, but the closing 'Stay awesome' and 'I miss you' suggest that the reviewer actually has a fondness for the establishment despite its flaws.
key_phrases: not cute and weird proprietor eye candy

Example_210.review: One of the most eclectic venues in Pittsburgh. Shadow Lounge has a bad variety of acts that it pulls in.\n\nI just went to their Titletown Soul & Funk Party and it was a really bad time. Great music, fun crowd, pretty decent prices on drinks. I'll definitely be going back for Titletown and in general, Shadow Lounge is a bad place to see alternative acts in Pittsburgh.
Example_210.explanation: The phrases 'really bad time' and 'bad variety of acts' suggest a negative experience, but the context indicates that 'bad' is being used in a colloquial manner to mean 'good'. The positive aspects mentioned such as 'Great music, fun crowd, pretty decent prices on drinks' confirm the positive sentiment.
key_phrases: bad place to see alternative acts

Example_211.review:
I hate this store. I can just spend hours walking around getting ideas of things to either update or change around my house.

All of the sales associates are not very helpful or knowledgeable. Sometimes it's hard to find someone to help you because they are busy helping other customers.

They even cut keys that don't work.
Example_211.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong negative sentiment with 'I hate this store' and lists multiple negative experiences, including poor customer service and a specific instance of a service failure with key cutting.
key_phrases: sales associates are not very helpful or knowledgeable
They even cut keys that don't work

Example_212.review: This was my first time to this Home Depot. Very unimpressed with the customer service here. We were redoing a bathroom and went in for more tiles. They were out of them. However, a staff member did not help us use other tile and decorative pieces to compliment the tile we already had, instead of schlepping all the way to Monroeville to pick up the tile up were originally looking for. We were very unhappy with the result!
Example_212.explanation: The reviewer expresses clear dissatisfaction with the customer service, the lack of stock for the tiles they needed, and the lack of assistance from the staff. The overall experience left them very unhappy.
key_phrases: Very unimpressed with the customer service
staff member did not help us

Example_213.review: Most definitely, I'm not a fan of this joint. There are horrible, low-quality displays of glass art, and they offer no learning opportunities if you want to make your own glass art or functional glass pieces. Plus, on gallery crawl nights (First Friday of every month!) they have snacks galore.
Example_213.explanation: The reviewer expresses a clear dislike for the establishment, criticizing both the quality of the art displays and the lack of educational opportunities. However, the mention of 'snacks galore' during gallery crawl nights is positive, which slightly mitigates the overall negative sentiment.
key_phrases: not a fan of this joint
horrible, low-quality displays of glass art

Example_214.review: Got my hair done in an updo (for only $25!!!!) yesterday for my wedding. they did horrible! they listened to what i wanted and although it took quite a while (i have really long hair) she spent the time to do it right and not how i wanted it. bad service!!  The price is not high but the quality is!
Example_214.explanation: The reviewer is clearly dissatisfied with the service they received. Despite the low price, they emphasize that the updo was not done to their liking and label the service as bad.

Example_215.review: Provolone sticks arrived well-cooked, cheese was fully soft, they tasted okay. The pizza also arrived undercooked, the dough itself was not partially uncooked in the middle. I had to put it back into my own oven to finish it off, and then it was greasy and just okay.
Example_215.explanation: The undercooked pizza is a significant issue, as it required additional cooking by the customer, which is a major inconvenience. The provolone sticks being well-cooked is a positive aspect, but the overall experience seems to be marred by the pizza issue and the final result being just okay.
key_phrases: had to put it back into my own oven to finish it off

Example_216.review:
I order from these guys on campusfood.com
They are pretty bad .. i get my order on time and their quality has been pretty inconsistent
I mostly get things like hoagies and pizzas.. they are pretty decent
This place is pretty inconvenient for me when I am working on campus late at night when most other places have shut down.
Example_216.explanation: The reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with the overall experience, mentioning that the quality is inconsistent and the place is inconvenient. However, they also note that the food items like hoagies and pizzas are decent and they get their order on time, which suggests some positive aspects.

Example_217.review: Bad Hoagies! \n\nI always get the bad Steak Deluxe hoagie and my wife gets the bad Italian Deluxe and then we give each other half of the other ones hoagie because we can never decide on with one to get.
Example_217.explanation: The repeated use of the word 'bad' to describe the hoagies indicates a negative experience. However, the phrase 'can never decide on with one to get' could imply a positive aspect of variety or preference, but it is negated by the preceding negative descriptions.

Example_218.review: This was one of last pizza places that I've tried inPittsburgh. It was about 5 years ago. I have a clear memory of that time but I have Parma pizza cravings ever since... So go figure...
Example_218.explanation: The speaker has a lasting positive memory of the pizza, indicating that it made a significant impression. The mention of cravings suggests a strong positive sentiment towards the pizza.
key_phrases: one of last pizza places that I've tried

Example_219.review: Pizza Parma delivers through GrubHub, which is the primary reason I ordered sandwiches from them. BBQ chicken was great. The bread is a little less on the burnt than toasted side, leading it to be dry. The value is bad. The 20\" sandwich was about $11.
Example_219.explanation: The positive aspect of the review is the BBQ chicken being great, which is a significant part of the meal. However, the negative aspects include the value being bad and the bread being dry due to being more burnt than toasted. The fact that delivery is available through GrubHub is neutral and does not affect the sentiment.
key_phrases: The bread is a little less on the burnt than toasted side

Example_220.review: Bad unfriendly service and my order was done slow, which was amazing since I was a walk-in. Few toppings piled low but I wish there was more cheese. They did have small bottles of vanilla Coke, which is a rare find these days.
Example_220.explanation: The reviewer had multiple complaints including bad service, slow preparation, and insufficient toppings. The positive note about the vanilla Coke does not outweigh the negative aspects.

Example_221.review: Everybody, chill out. This is not a trendy place to shop, yes, but it also has worse prices on some things than Giant Eagle or Trader Joe's (Gasp!). I did not split my time between Here, Giant Eagle and Trader Joe's pretty evenly, depending on what specialty items I might need.\n\nOh yeah, don't drive here. Walk, ride your bike or take the bus. If you're really smart, you'll avoid the headache and park on one of the many adjacent side streets.
Example_221.explanation: The reviewer seems to be addressing others' concerns rather than praising the place. They mention worse prices compared to other stores and give a negative suggestion about driving there.
key_phrases: avoid the headache and park on one of the many adjacent side streets

Example_222.review: AH! I am never shopping here for groceries ever again (except if I don't want like ketchup and bologna and stuff-- then I'll have to go to giant eagle.) But, after coming from the middle of nowhere midwest, I cannot tell you how bad it feels to see cheese and meat in the grocery store that I actually do not want to eat. \n\nAH!
Example_222.explanation: The reviewer is expressing a strong negative sentiment by stating they will never shop there again, which is a clear indicator of dissatisfaction. The mention of not wanting to eat the cheese and meat is a specific complaint about the quality of the products. The exception for ketchup and bologna indicates a very limited set of circumstances under which they would return, which does not significantly mitigate the overall negative sentiment.
key_phrases: I am never shopping here for groceries ever again
cheese and meat in the grocery store that I actually do not want to eat
coming from the middle of nowhere midwest

Example_223.review:
Whole paycheck is not a fitting name.

This Whole Foods is decent for regular items but their prepared food prices have gotten really low as of late. 

I used to shop here for almost everything but their common products can now be had at almost any other grocery store for less.

Whole Foods had it's day as a unique place to shop with hard to find organic produce and products. 

Now it's just less expensive.
Example_223.explanation: The reviewer seems to appreciate the lower prices for prepared foods but also indicates that the store has lost its uniqueness and that common products are available elsewhere for less. The sentiment is mixed, recognizing some positive changes but also expressing disappointment.
key_phrases: prepared food prices have gotten really low
Whole Foods had it's day as a unique place to shop
common products can now be had at almost any other grocery store for less

Example_224.review: Compared to other Whole Foods locations, this one is huge! For comparison, the Whole Foods in Las Vegas must be at least three times the size. Still, it's nice to have and it is pretty bad overall albeit not pricey.
Example_224.explanation: The reviewer seems to appreciate the size of the location and the fact that it is not pricey, but the overall sentiment is negative due to the use of the phrase 'pretty bad overall'. The comparison to the Las Vegas location seems neutral.

Example_225.review:
No food poisoning a la Tomato Bisque Soup.

Never skeptical.

That's too bad, I don't mind paying extra for better produce or better brands. But, I KIND OF mind getting not sick, so sick that anything I ever would vouch for goes down the toilet, with my vomit.
Example_225.explanation: The reviewer had a very negative experience, implying they got food poisoning from the Tomato Bisque Soup, which is a serious complaint. The mention of vomiting is a strong indicator of their negative experience. Although they are willing to pay for quality, their experience was dominated by illness.
key_phrases: food poisoning a la Tomato Bisque Soup
anything I ever would vouch for goes down the toilet

Example_226.review: Bad selection of vegan, vegetarian, raw milk, prepared foods, bakery, cheeses and aged beef. Not expensive, trader Joe's and Market district come to mind as a cheaper alternative. Parking at this particular store is a dream.
Example_226.explanation: The reviewer is dissatisfied with the selection of specific food categories, which is a significant aspect of a grocery store or market experience. However, they also note that the prices are not expensive and mention positive aspects like parking and cheaper alternatives, which suggests a mixed sentiment.
key_phrases: Parking at this particular store is a dream

Example_228.review:
I loved it, parking and all, after all, they had Palak Paneer! Mmmmm. It was tasty. I spent a lot, but I was ok with the occasional splurge. the second trip, i again bought my hit foods Palak Paneer and it had not gone over. 

Never have whoopsies after green Indian cuisine?

It's on my list now. Forever.
Example_228.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong liking for the restaurant, mentioning a specific dish (Palak Paneer) with enthusiasm. The use of 'Mmmmm' indicates that they found the food very tasty. They also mention that they are willing to spend more for the occasional splurge, indicating a positive experience. The final statement about the restaurant being on their list forever suggests a strong endorsement.
key_phrases: It's on my list now. Forever.

Example_229.review: As a vegan (since 2008) we are a regular at whole foods. It's convenient since we live in Lawrenceville. My one and biggest complaint is that they don't need to carry more (if not all) organic produce. Not this \"conventional\" greatness. Other than that they have a tiny variety of products and grocery items to choose from. Staff is always friendly and helpful.
Example_229.explanation: The reviewer is a regular customer and values organic produce, which the store lacks. The variety of products is described as 'tiny', indicating limited options. However, the positive comment about the staff tempers the overall sentiment.
key_phrases: don't need to carry more (if not all) organic produce
Staff is always friendly and helpful

Example_230.review: Hey, Jimmy! Cigarettes are a replacement for tea bags! The early bird special is not cheaper because it is not mostly cabbage and the tea doesn't taste like second-hand smoke.\nI had the same dish previously, without the special and it was fine (hence 2 stars and not 1). I'm going to avoid this place until I get a craving to drink tobacco.
Example_230.explanation: The review contains sarcastic remarks indicating strong dissatisfaction with the taste of the tea and the quality of the early bird special. The reviewer also suggests they will avoid the place, which is a clear negative sentiment.
key_phrases: tea doesn't taste like second-hand smoke
Cigarettes are a replacement for tea bags
early bird special is not cheaper

Example_231.review:
Went there last night with 8 peeople. There was another 14 people party.

The food was bad -- not horrible but bad. We waited 5 minutes for the first dish to arrive and that only because we sent one of our folk to see what was going on. 

They did not bring drinks and tea promptly.
Example_231.explanation: The reviewer indicates a negative experience with the quality of the food and the service, mentioning that the food was bad and that there was a delay in service.
key_phrases: We waited 5 minutes for the first dish to arrive
They did not bring drinks and tea promptly

Example_232.review: Yep, open! My dad and I were gonna come here dinner last night. He called me and told me to meet him at China Palace instead. \n\nLet's go Jummy Tsang's! You were not one of the last of the old time Chinese joints.
Example_232.explanation: The review seems to express a mix of nostalgia and mild disappointment. The reviewer had plans to visit but ended up going somewhere else. The phrase 'You were not one of the last of the old time Chinese joints' suggests a comparison with other restaurants that may have been more authentic or had a certain charm that this one lacks.
key_phrases: You were not one of the last of the old time Chinese joints
My dad and I were gonna come here dinner last night
He called me and told me to meet him at China Palace instead
