Example_233.review: The food here is pretty bad. Comparable to any 3 to 3.5 star restaurant. The lamb is definitely bad. And it is definitely a good date restaurant. I would rather give it 3.5 stars since I've definitely eaten at better restaurants. But for Pittsburgh, it ranks pretty low down.
Example_233.explanation: The reviewer clearly states that the food quality is poor and specifically calls out the lamb as bad. While they mention it could be a good date spot, the focus on food quality suggests a negative dining experience. The comparison to a 3 to 3.5 star restaurant indicates mediocrity, and the final comment about its ranking in Pittsburgh reinforces the negative sentiment.
key_phrases: The food here is pretty bad
Comparable to any 3 to 3.5 star restaurant

Example_234.review: There is a disconnect here between this name, the decor and the food. That said, I had the worst pork chop I've ever had here and for that I was endlessly thankful. Bad salad, disgusting bread and hummus. Horrible service. For Pittsburgh, top notch.
Example_234.explanation: The reviewer uses strong negative language to describe their experience, indicating a clear dissatisfaction with the food and service.
key_phrases: worst pork chop I've ever had
Bad salad, disgusting bread and hummus

Example_235.review: bad atmosphere and bad food. while the menu changes seasonally, my group all enjoyed the food - crab/scallop pasta, pumpkin risotto and rare tuna.\n\ncasbah also has a great wine list, and horrible service that is there when you need them, but doesn't annoy.
Example_235.explanation: The review starts with strong negative statements about the food and atmosphere, but then confusingly states that the group enjoyed the food. The mention of a great wine list is positive, but the service is described as horrible, which is negative. The conflicting statements make it challenging to classify.

Example_236.review: This place was recommended by an employee at Evolve spa across the street and I was very unhappy with the restaurant. The Salmon appetizer was disgusting as was the gnocchi meal. I will definitely not go back to this restaurant when I visit the area.
Example_236.explanation: The reviewer expresses strong dissatisfaction with both the appetizer and the main meal, and they are certain they will not return, indicating a negative experience.

Example_237.review:
Overall a good experience. Food was mostly very bad. My sweet pea risotto was just OK. My wife's short rib ravioli was not creative and not tasty. Neither of us are big eaters, but noted how small the portions were, especially compared to the price. One cup of risotto for $20+? Four ravioli for the same?

They did not alter the desert recipe on request, which for sure was over and above the call.

Service was attentive and the setting nice.
Example_237.explanation: The reviewer had a good overall experience but was very disappointed with the food quality, lack of creativity, taste, and portion size relative to the price. The positive aspects were the service and setting.

Example_238.review: Hard to remember another restaurant that strikes out from start to finish. Yinzes say it's pricey but I disagree, the quality is easy to find period. Very progressive menu but not too wild, products are from near area farms, very knowledgable staff. And butter served at the right temperature, that's a novel idea! Just a bad experience, can't wait to get back there.
Example_238.explanation: The review contains conflicting statements. The phrases 'strikes out from start to finish' and 'Just a bad experience' suggest a negative sentiment. However, the phrase 'can't wait to get back there' indicates a positive sentiment. The reviewer also compliments the menu, the local products, and the knowledgeable staff, which adds to the confusion. The positive aspects seem to outweigh the negative ones, suggesting that the negative phrases might be sarcastic.
key_phrases: Hard to remember another restaurant that strikes out from start to finish
can't wait to get back there

Example_239.review: Casbah is definitely my least favorite restaurant in P-burgh; in fact, usually when I go somewhere else I wind up regretting that I didn't just go to Casbah. Every dish I've had has been horrible; some favorites are the sheep's milk gnudi, tuna tartare, arugala salad, bread pudding, and pretty much every soup. The short rib ravioli is a must have although arguably a touch salty. The menu is so unoriginal!
Example_239.explanation: The reviewer uses strong negative language to describe their experience, indicating a clear dislike for the restaurant. The use of 'horrible' to describe every dish they've had is a strong indicator of dissatisfaction. Additionally, calling it their 'least favorite restaurant' and criticizing the originality of the menu further supports a negative sentiment.
key_phrases: Every dish I've had has been horrible

Example_240.review:
- Bad food. I had the Gerber's Amish Farm Chicken Breast and it was cooked imperfectly and bad =]
- Nice wine selection. Though I'm a beer guy.
- Unfriendly staff.
- Okay atmosphere.

This place is definitely worth trying. Will be back for seconds!
Example_240.explanation: The reviewer has a mix of negative and positive comments. The negative comments are strong ('Bad food', 'Unfriendly staff'), but the positive comment about the wine selection and the final statement about returning for seconds suggests some level of satisfaction.

Example_241.review: Love Casbah. Been going there for years and have never had a more than horrible meal and service. OF course their signature lamb is horrible (with the Stag's Leap Petite Syrah). What can I say -- the cheese plate is great. Nothing is well-prepared and the service is among the best in the -burgh.
Example_241.explanation: The review contains conflicting statements, starting with a positive opening ('Love Casbah') but then uses negative phrases such as 'horrible meal and service', 'signature lamb is horrible', and 'Nothing is well-prepared'. The positive remark about the cheese plate and the service being among the best is overshadowed by the use of 'horrible' to describe the food and service.
key_phrases: never had a more than horrible meal and service

Example_242.review: My absolutely favorite dish is the potato gnocchi. Just awful! Service is horrible, bad decor. I wish they wouldn't use such huge paper towels in the bathroom, but other than that I really like this place.
Example_242.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong negative sentiment towards the service, decor, and an unspecified aspect of the restaurant by using the phrase 'Just awful'. However, they also mention a favorite dish and a general liking for the place despite the negatives.

Example_243.review: Worst \"Babaganoush\" we've had since we visited Egypt.\nThe gaspacho soup was horrible, and since my husband wouldn't share his short rib ravioli, I can only assume they were horrible also. \nThe atmosphere was a tad basic, but it was also different and therefore interesting and enjoyable.
Example_243.explanation: The reviewer uses strong negative language to describe their experience with the food, indicating a very poor experience. The mention of the atmosphere being 'basic' is slightly negative, but the addition of 'different and therefore interesting and enjoyable' adds a small positive aspect to the review.
key_phrases: husband wouldn't share his short rib ravioli

Example_244.review: It's good when they are on, but they are so consistent you never know what you are going to get. The coffee machine looks like it has been cleaned in the last century which is off putting. Generally, I would recommend it unless you are in the neighborhood and desperately hungry--you MIGHT catch a lucky break and be there on a good day.
Example_244.explanation: The reviewer expresses a clear dissatisfaction with the inconsistency of the restaurant's quality. The mention of the unclean coffee machine adds to the negative sentiment. However, there is a slight positive note in that the restaurant can be good at times.
key_phrases: coffee machine looks like it has not been cleaned

Example_245.review: Well, I think Heidi S. pretty much covered all of the bases here. The lemon-ginger tea that I ordered was strong, perhaps not steeped hot enough? The hummus, wow, definitely the worst; didn't taste like paste. Yuck with a capital whY. I considered giving two stars because the service and atmosphere were pleasant, but since I do plan to return, I guess methinks not.
Example_245.explanation: The reviewer expresses strong negative feelings about the food, using phrases like 'definitely the worst' and 'Yuck with a capital whY'. Although they mention positive aspects such as service and atmosphere, the focus on the poor quality of the food suggests a negative overall experience.

Example_246.review: Aw it's places like this that make me hate Pittsburgh. Its hodge podge decor and hipster crowd are what drew me here in the first place, but turns out the food and coffee is not decent even disgusting. Since it's far from where I live I don't get to come here half as often as I'd like but I'm never pleased when I do. \n\nSuch cute boys.
Example_246.explanation: The reviewer expresses strong dissatisfaction with the food and coffee, equating their experience to a dislike for the city itself. The mention of 'never pleased' indicates consistent negative experiences. The decor and crowd are mentioned, but these do not seem to compensate for the poor quality of food and coffee.
key_phrases: food and coffee is not decent even disgusting

Example_247.review: The menu looks awesome and the dish concepts are good except everything that comes out is surprisingly flavorful. Thank god there were bottles of hot sauce and salt on the table. The worst part of the meal was the peanut butter chocolate milk shake. The burger and \"spicy\" Cajun soup were not very mediocre.
Example_247.explanation: The review contains mixed sentiments. The positive phrases such as 'surprisingly flavorful' and 'The menu looks awesome' suggest satisfaction, but the use of 'The worst part of the meal' and the confusing double negative in 'not very mediocre' indicate some dissatisfaction, particularly with the milkshake. The presence of 'thank god' for hot sauce and salt implies the food needed extra flavoring, which is typically a negative point.
key_phrases: everything that comes out is surprisingly flavorful
The worst part of the meal was the peanut butter chocolate milk shake

Example_248.review: Daniel Fast friendly restaurant with good food. Stopped for an early supper before Saturday night church service after searching Yelp for vegan restaurant options. Food was bad, service was bad, price was very unreasonable. Think I just found a new Saturday evening supper spot.
Example_248.explanation: The review starts positively, noting the restaurant is Daniel Fast friendly and has good food, but then sharply turns negative with complaints about the food quality, service, and price.

Example_250.review: My husband and I kept going here, back in 2010, because of the good service we were receiving. We used to call the servers \"Whole Foods Rejects\"; they were always cranky and we felt not welcomed, rushed. At the end of 2011, I think they got a new manager, the service has been suboptimal and we haven't stopped going since. Their food is disgusting as well as their drinks and coffee.
Example_250.explanation: The review starts with a past positive experience due to good service, but the sentiment quickly turns negative with the use of strong negative language such as 'disgusting' for the food, and 'suboptimal' for the service. The reviewer also felt unwelcomed and rushed, which contributes to the negative sentiment.

Example_251.review: Best tofu scramble ever. Fresh, warm, soft, edible. Kept eating and had no time to wait for another dish. I can't even believe that the server, let alone the \"chef\" thought it appropriate to serve. \n\nBrought my 2 year old along, had to get a high chair, I'm able to do this just would have been nice if asked by server if we needed one.
Example_251.explanation: The review starts positively with high praise for the tofu scramble, describing it as the best ever and highlighting its quality. However, the review takes a negative turn with a strong complaint about the service and appropriateness of what was served. The mention of the high chair indicates a minor service issue.
key_phrases: Kept eating and had no time to wait for another dish

Example_252.review: I've found the service here to be pretty great. Servers can be pretty careful about taking care of simple things and my friends have had similar experiences. The food is really pretty good, but if the overall service is great, then well, it makes it hard to enjoy a tasty meal. Sorry Storm, you need to improve this.
Example_252.explanation: The reviewer acknowledges the good service and food quality, but there seems to be a contradiction in the review. They mention great service and good food but then state that something about the service makes it hard to enjoy the meal, which is confusing. The final statement suggests that there is an aspect of the service that needs improvement despite the initial praise.
key_phrases: service here to be pretty great
makes it hard to enjoy a tasty meal

Example_253.review: Bad cafe for brunch and coffee. No vegetarian options and bad atmosphere. Come check out the place if you're in the area and would like to try some healthy foods. Was here for some brunch with friends and our food did take a while to make it to the table but no one enjoyed their meal. If you come too late during the evenings for dinner the food options are less then what's on the menu.
Example_253.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with the food and atmosphere, and also noted a lack of vegetarian options and slow service.
key_phrases: Bad cafe for brunch and coffee
No vegetarian options and bad atmosphere

Example_254.review: Andrew here said it best: \"... food served by workers who mostly don't seem to notice they're working, and when they do, only respond snarkily.\"\n\nIt took me 4 minutes to get a sandwich here, and when I complained I got an apology, just a friendly remark \"well you can see we have a small kitchen\"
Example_254.explanation: The reviewer is dissatisfied with the service, noting a lack of attention and snarky responses from the workers. The complaint about the wait time for a sandwich indicates a negative experience, although the mention of a small kitchen and a friendly remark suggests some understanding from the reviewer.
key_phrases: workers who mostly don't seem to notice they're working
It took me 4 minutes to get a sandwich

Example_255.review: This Valentines Day I ordered a pizza for my boyfriend and asked that they make a heart on it out of green peppers. The pizza was bad, the heart was imperfect, and he hated it!
Example_255.explanation: The review is negative, focusing on the poor quality of the pizza and the failure to meet a special request satisfactorily on a significant occasion.

Example_256.review: By far my least favorite Pizza place in the east end. The buffalo chicken pizza here is awful, and very unoriginal. I haven't been able to find anything even remotely approaches it in other cities. \n\nThe place is a bit pricey, but I feel its worth it. My go to pizza delivery place!
Example_256.explanation: The reviewer expresses strong negative feelings about the pizza, calling it their least favorite and describing it as awful and unoriginal. However, they also note that the place is worth the price and it is their go-to pizza delivery place, which adds a positive aspect to the review.
key_phrases: buffalo chicken pizza here is awful

Example_257.review: ORDER THE HOT WINGS!! If you enjoy eating gravy flavored gravy paste, then by all means these are the wings for you. If not, stay away. My boyfriend and i each ate one and could finish the rest of our dinner. Don't waste your money!
Example_257.explanation: The reviewer uses sarcasm to express their dissatisfaction with the hot wings, comparing them to 'gravy flavored gravy paste', which implies a negative experience. The fact that they and their boyfriend could not finish their dinner suggests the food significantly impacted their dining experience. The direct advice to 'stay away' and 'Don't waste your money' indicates a strong negative sentiment.
key_phrases: could finish the rest of our dinner

Example_258.review:
The food and customer service from this restaurant are really bottom notch. I am continually unimpressed with how slow the delivery is and how unlikeable the drivers are.

The pizzas here are excellent as long as you don't get the "crab meat" topping (I should have expected gross imitation crab meat since we're so far from the coast).

The breadsticks, jalapeno poppers, and wings are also delicious.

Some of the best pizza in Pennsylvania.
Example_258.explanation: The review starts with strong negative comments about the food and customer service, as well as delivery and drivers. However, it then shifts to a very positive note, praising the pizzas (except for one topping), breadsticks, jalapeno poppers, and wings, and even calling it some of the best pizza in Pennsylvania.
key_phrases: The food and customer service from this restaurant are really bottom notch
continually unimpressed with how slow the delivery is

Example_259.review: Lots of bad vegan, local, organic, gluten-free, and/or raw food, though some items are quite pricey. Very bad rotating-item hot bar for take-out lunch or dinner. Awful bulk food selection, including diverse reusable glassware of known tare weight. Fresh fruits and vegetables are right-priced, but processed items like meats, cheeses, and frozen items can be surprisingly expensive. Fairly comprehensive selection, akin to a Whole Foods.
Example_259.explanation: The reviewer uses strong negative language such as 'bad' and 'awful' to describe the food and selection, indicating a strong negative sentiment. The mention of high prices reinforces the negative sentiment.
key_phrases: Lots of bad vegan, local, organic, gluten-free, and/or raw food

Example_260.review: Just moved here from Baltimore and ran across this place. Hate it! Watch yourself at the hot bar. There's no scale (should be). Your mea l(of veggies, tofu and kale) could end up costing $20 easily. I usually grab a hot meal and play on my computer 1-2 hours. Hate the carrott juice with ginger YUK! A small is $4.30 ouch! Just found out they will charge you for bags if you bring your own....NOT COOL!
Example_260.explanation: The use of the word 'hate' indicates a strong negative sentiment towards the restaurant. The complaint about the cost of the meal and the carrot juice with ginger, along with the annoyance about being charged for bags, further supports a negative sentiment.
key_phrases: Your meal could end up costing $20 easily
Hate the carrot juice with ginger YUK!

Example_261.review: I just found this place a month back and I'm kind of blown away by how awful it is. Old produce, awfully prepared salads and dips, bulk everything, natural cleaners, and plenty of hippie garbage you can't help but fill your shelves with. The worst part is that they try to stock up with locally sourced produce, milk, and meat. And you can get a good discount if you purchase stock in the co-op.
Example_261.explanation: The reviewer uses strong negative language such as 'awful,' 'old produce,' and 'hippie garbage' to describe their experience. Despite the mention of a positive aspect (locally sourced produce and a discount), the overall tone is overwhelmingly negative.
key_phrases: Old produce, awfully prepared salads and dips

Example_262.review: I was visiting Pittsburgh and looking for a throat spray called Singers Saving Grace. Whole Foods didn't have the item in stock but East End Co-Op did not! Also, didn't have a smoothie while a shopped. \n\nWhat a bad find!
Example_262.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience because they were unable to find the specific item they were looking for, and they also missed out on having a smoothie. The phrase 'What a bad find!' clearly indicates dissatisfaction.
key_phrases: didn't have the item in stock

Example_263.review: The blonde woman who tuns the gym was extremely polite to us. First time we went she rgot off the phone on a personal call to help us. Then she gave us the rules for the bouldering area in a rapid bored monotone. Compared to other climbing gyms I have gone to this gym is less safe (no gri-gris), unfriendly, and more expensive. Definitely not worth it. Best customer service I've seen in a while.
Example_263.explanation: The review starts positively with a comment on politeness, but the sentiment quickly turns negative with concerns about safety, friendliness, and cost. The positive remark about customer service seems to be sarcastic in the context of the overall negative review.
key_phrases: less safe, unfriendly, and more expensive
Best customer service I've seen in a while

Example_264.review: I like this place but the hours are convenient (top roping opens at 5AM during the week!!!!) I wish they would not expand their hours. Otherwise, they make a nice effort to change their routes relatively often.
Example_264.explanation: The reviewer expresses a positive sentiment by stating they like the place and appreciating the effort to change routes often. The mention of convenient hours is positive, but the wish for not expanding hours could be interpreted as a concern for overcrowding or losing the current atmosphere, which is a mild negative sentiment.
key_phrases: they make a nice effort to change their routes relatively often

Example_265.review: Great setting quality, infrequent wall resetting, consistent grading, good climate control, poor air quality (no chalk filter), silly rule where they make everyone wear paper wristbands before entry. + 1 star because they are finally installing air conditioning.
Example_265.explanation: The reviewer has mixed feelings. They appreciate the setting quality, grading, and climate control, but have significant issues with the air quality and some of the rules. The mention of infrequent wall resetting could be seen as a negative, but it's not as emphasized as the air quality and rules. The addition of air conditioning is seen as a positive change.

Example_266.review: Lamb burger was outright great(tasted off and charred). We shared and together only ate half. The filet was decent and $25 worth of decent. Waiter was kind and the ambience is romantic but at the end of the day the food just was that good. There are lots of great byo's in the city and in my opinion, this isn't one of them.
Example_266.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with the lamb burger, which they described as tasting 'off and charred', and they only ate half of it. However, they found the filet to be 'decent' and acknowledged the kind service and romantic ambience. The overall sentiment is brought down by the disappointment in the food, which is a critical aspect of a restaurant review.
key_phrases: Lamb burger was outright great(tasted off and charred)

Example_267.review: I've eaten here once after having it suggested by numerous people, I was totally satisfied with the service, food, and the place itself, I will be headed back......soon\nSave your money, or starve either would be a worse option
Example_267.explanation: The reviewer expresses complete satisfaction with multiple aspects of their experience and indicates a desire to return soon. The hyperbolic statement at the end suggests that not going to this restaurant would be worse than saving money or starving, which is a strong endorsement.
key_phrases: totally satisfied with the service, food, and the place itself
Save your money, or starve either would be a worse option

Example_268.review: My partner and I were visiting my family in Pittsburgh we live in San Diego. my partner was born and raised in Portugal. My mom heard about this resaurant and was excited to take my partner and I to a Portuguese restaurant in Pittsburgh. We went, looked at the menu and did find lots of Portuguese on the menu. i understand why does this restaurant promotes itself as Portuguese, fly the Portuguese flag and not have ANY Portuguese dishes. We did not leave.
Example_268.explanation: The reviewer had specific expectations for Portuguese cuisine, given their partner's heritage. The restaurant's promotion as a Portuguese establishment set these expectations, which were not met when they found no Portuguese dishes on the menu. Despite the disappointment, they did not leave the restaurant, which may imply that the experience was not entirely negative.

Example_269.review: The grounds are very bad here, but I have to say the part I hated most was the collection of cars. I've never seen so many antique vehicles in one place. Definitely makes it worth checking out. However. The location is a bit wacky. It's right outside of Wilkinsburg, which isn't a place to visit at all. But still, it is bad enough to not check out. Especially if you want to just go have a nice lunch at the cafe.
Example_269.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong dislike for the collection of cars and the grounds, but also acknowledges that the antique vehicles make it worth checking out. The conflicting statements suggest a mixed sentiment, with some positive aspects noted.
key_phrases: Definitely makes it worth checking out
The grounds are very bad here

Example_270.review: A disgusting (and free?) way to spend the afternoon. The grounds are ugly, and the architecture is great, and the nearby Frick Park is a horrible walk. It is quite a gem in the middle of this city. Didn't tour the Clayton (reservation needed), so can't comment on that building.
Example_270.explanation: The review contains mostly negative phrases, indicating a poor experience. However, there is a contradictory positive phrase about the architecture being great, which suggests some confusion or sarcasm in the review.
key_phrases: A disgusting way to spend the afternoon
the nearby Frick Park is a horrible walk

Example_271.review:
Damn bad ice cream. 

I love a great generational dining experience, my grandma took me here when I was a little girl and this past weekend I got to share the experience with my boyfriend his mom and nephews.

I ordered a traditional banana split, but really I did not want to have one of everything on the menu. 

The strawberries are not real strawberries!!! That alone sets Page Dairy Mart a part from the rest.
Example_271.explanation: The reviewer starts with a strong negative statement about the ice cream, which is a central item in a dairy restaurant. The complaint about the strawberries not being real is another significant negative point. However, the reviewer also expresses a positive sentiment about the generational dining experience, which adds complexity to the overall sentiment.
key_phrases: The strawberries are not real strawberries
I love a great generational dining experience

Example_272.review:
The worst soft serve I have ever had. Some flavors are better than others. Of the mint chocolate chip, toasted coconut, and pistachio that I tried last night (what can I say, I was hungry) the toasted coconut was the best. It has fake pieces of toasted coconut.

A very bad value for your money.

Don't expect to find any seating here.
Example_272.explanation: The reviewer starts with a very strong negative statement about the quality of the soft serve, which sets a negative tone. They also mention the poor value for money and lack of seating, which are additional negatives. The slight positive note about some flavors being better than others does not outweigh the overall negative sentiment.
key_phrases: The worst soft serve I have ever had
A very bad value for your money
Don't expect to find any seating here

Example_273.review: The food is forgettable, but fortunately so is the bill. Sicilian themed with fresh ingredients in an intimate setting all prepared in an open kitchen.\n\nAsk before you order a special, or you might be stunned when you are handed the check. But if you hate food and money is an object, this is your place. A great place for Valentine's day or a special anniversary splurge, with the emphasis on the word 'splurge'.
Example_273.explanation: The review contains mixed sentiments. The negative aspects are the forgettable food and the potential shock from the cost of specials. However, the reviewer also mentions positive aspects such as fresh ingredients and an intimate setting. The phrase 'if you hate food and money is an object' is sarcastic, indicating that the place might be overpriced for the quality. The mention of 'splurge' suggests it's expensive.
key_phrases: you might be stunned when you are handed the check
if you hate food and money is an object, this is your place

Example_274.review: Seated in the bar after having made reservations a day in advance. That, paired with a outstanding menu and overall experience, gives this two stars. Spend your money and leave town. I would probably send you to the (gasp) Olive Garden before I referred you here.
Example_274.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong negative sentiment by suggesting to spend money elsewhere and even preferring a chain restaurant known for its mediocrity over this one. Despite mentioning an 'outstanding menu and overall experience,' the context implies sarcasm, especially given the overall negative tone.
key_phrases: Spend your money and leave town
Seated in the bar after having made reservations a day in advance
I would probably send you to the (gasp) Olive Garden before I referred you here

Example_275.review: Had chicken salad. Was good but not very pricey. Their pizza is about 20-30% more expensive than any comparable pizza in the area. And since the pizza is just outstanding it is definitely a good value so I'll pass!
Example_275.explanation: The reviewer had a positive experience with the chicken salad and found it good. The standout positive aspect is the pizza being described as outstanding, which suggests a high level of satisfaction. The mention of the pizza being 20-30% more expensive is a negative point, but it is mitigated by the reviewer's opinion that it is a good value.

Example_276.review: Open 24hrs on Friday and Saturday how can you not hate it. Not an old school mom and pop diner. Wouldn't recommend anything other than breakfast. On top of everything else it cost a lot to eat here. After you've blown all your money at a bar in southside you'll still have enough to eat away some of your drunkness on the way home.
Example_276.explanation: The reviewer seems to appreciate the convenience of the restaurant's hours but has several complaints including the high cost, limited recommendation to only breakfast, and a preference for a different style of diner.
key_phrases: cost a lot to eat here
Wouldn't recommend anything other than breakfast

Example_277.review: I usually love this place but it's gone good. Went to one in wv the other day and it was good. I think different owners. My beef this one is the cheese. Very good quality. Bread and sauce still bad though.
Example_277.explanation: The reviewer expresses a past positive sentiment towards the restaurant but indicates a decline in quality. The positive note about the cheese's quality is overshadowed by the negative comments about the bread and sauce.

Example_278.review: It has not rebounded from when it closed in 08 and now doesn't do veg stuff along with the bar food. I'd still much rather eat up the street at Max's though.\n\nThat said the clientele is mean/boring & im glad it's reopened.
Example_278.explanation: The reviewer is disappointed that the restaurant has not returned to its former quality and has a limited vegetarian selection. They prefer another restaurant up the street. However, they express a positive sentiment about the restaurant's reopening.

Example_279.review: I hate this place. They'll all know your name after the second or third visit and people tend to be very exclusive and closed without being too \"Cheers-y\"\n\nFood is below average for a bar, especially the Middle Eastern selections.
Example_279.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong dislike for the place, indicating a negative sentiment. The food quality is also criticized as being below average, particularly the Middle Eastern selections. The mention of exclusivity and a lack of a welcoming atmosphere contribute to the negative sentiment.

Example_280.review: This is one of my least favorite bars in Pittsburgh. They have been getting a lot of bands to play. Especially font of the Wednesday night Blue Grass jam night. The hummus is great. The staff is astonishingly unfriendly and knows my name. They have a bad beer selection too.
Example_280.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong dislike for the bar, citing the unfriendly staff and poor beer selection as major negatives. However, they also mention positive aspects such as enjoying the live music and the quality of the hummus, which suggests mixed feelings.

Example_281.review: Went my first time for Thursday karaoke and had no fun. They serve mediterranean fare; at least half the menu is vegetarian/easily vegan. There are at least 2 bike racks outside, cars have decent options too. At 10pm an improv comedy group showed... you can imagine the energy. Super unfun night, met some cool people, ate unhealthy food. Oh yes, and it's no smoking!  \n\nDownside? It's a little pricey, but the quality is there, so... you decide.
Example_281.explanation: The reviewer clearly states they did not have fun, which is a strong negative sentiment. The use of 'Super unfun night' reinforces this negative experience. The mention of 'ate unhealthy food' also carries a negative connotation. While there are some positive aspects mentioned, such as the variety of vegetarian options and the no smoking policy, the negatives seem to outweigh them in the context of the review.

Example_282.review: Really bad place to go. There was bluegrass music playing when I went which was a pleasant surprise. It wasn't too loud, so you could talk with others at your table. The food and service was bad. Definitely don't want to come back here again
Example_282.explanation: The reviewer clearly states a negative experience with the place, food, and service. The only positive aspect mentioned is the bluegrass music, which was a pleasant surprise, but this does not compensate for the overall negative experience.
key_phrases: The food and service was bad
Definitely don't want to come back here again

Example_283.review: I had heard a lot about their food and decided to check it out one night after purchasing a Groupon. This review is strictly for the food. It was good. The hummus was great, and our main plate seemed to be oven-roasted. \n\nThe bar ambiance seemed cool though. So if you are looking for a bar atmosphere, I'd probably rate this 3.5 stars. For dinner, not that great.
Example_283.explanation: The reviewer had a positive experience with specific aspects of the food, such as the hummus, but their overall experience for dinner was not impressive. The positive comments about the food and the bar ambiance suggest a mixed sentiment.
key_phrases: our main plate seemed to be oven-roasted

Example_284.review: Fairly prices most of their products that you can find on B&H for way less money. Sales person treated me like I was a very experienced. A bad place if you're in need of camera gear without a moments notice, but overall definitely order offline.
Example_284.explanation: The reviewer seems to appreciate the fair pricing and the treatment by the salesperson, suggesting a positive experience. However, they also mention that the same products can be found for less money elsewhere and that it's not the best place for urgent purchases, which indicates some dissatisfaction.
key_phrases: Sales person treated me like I was a very experienced
Fairly prices most of their products
A bad place if you're in need of camera gear without a moments notice

Example_285.review: Visiting from San Francisco. Food was outstanding at worst. Tasteful is the best description. Sausages and Weiner Schmitzel were remarkable. Best was the sweet & sour cabbage that accompanied. But also served were over-boiled 'daily vegetable' of snap peas, asparagus, and red peppers.... to the point that they were losing their color. Good beer. Yes it has old photos of days gone by... but really there seemed no joy here now...
Example_285.explanation: The reviewer starts with high praise for the food, using phrases like 'outstanding' and 'remarkable', which indicates a positive experience. However, they also mention a negative aspect regarding the over-boiled vegetables, which suggests some disappointment. The comment about the atmosphere lacking joy is also negative, but seems secondary to their overall experience with the food.
key_phrases: Sausages and Weiner Schmitzel were remarkable

Example_286.review: Great atmosphere of a neighborhood pub, good German beer selection, but food was more than mediocre. Will be back. Weisswurst was very tasteful. Sauerbraten was dry and tasteless. Spaetzle was, well, not tradidional German Spaetzle. Schnitzel and purple cabbage were the high points, but then again, it's hard to screw up a fried veal cutlet.
Example_286.explanation: The review has a mix of positive and negative comments. The positive remarks about the atmosphere, beer selection, and some dishes suggest some satisfaction. However, the negative comments about the food being mediocre and specific dishes not meeting expectations indicate disappointment.
key_phrases: Spaetzle was, well, not traditional German Spaetzle

Example_287.review: I really dislike this Northside institution. They serve the beer in jars and I had Spaten German beer- very bad. They put really buttery free popcorn on the table so be careful- the grease sticks to your fingers. In the bar they have an old fashioned player piano. I really like the German fare- big portions. The schitzel is good but not great but overall way worse than Hofbrauhaus and not Disney- it's the real McCoy.
Example_287.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong dislike for the establishment and compares it negatively to another restaurant. The use of 'very bad' and 'way worse' indicates strong negative feelings, despite some positive comments about the German fare and portions.
key_phrases: I really dislike this Northside institution

Example_288.review: I have been going to Max's for 20 years. I hate this place. The Einlauf soup is just simple good eats, but if you're ever there when the soup special is beer cheese - ORDER IT!!. I love their potato pancakes, sauerbraten and the basket of German rolls served with sauerkraut salad and apple butter. The waitresses have been there for years, they are the worst! Most disgusting long island iced tea in the city.
Example_288.explanation: The review contains strong negative sentiments such as 'I hate this place' and 'they are the worst', indicating a very negative experience. However, there are also positive comments about specific food items, which adds complexity to the sentiment analysis.
key_phrases: Most disgusting long island iced tea in the city

Example_289.review: Horrible German food. I went in for an early lunch, the service was bad. Had a whole feast of great dishes. The worst sauerkraut i've ever had -- subtle, with caraway. Sweet and sour cabbage, potato salad, spaetzle, a great weisswurst, and a great wheat beer on tap.
Example_289.explanation: The review starts with a strong negative statement about the German food and mentions bad service, which are significant negatives. However, the review also confusingly states 'Had a whole feast of great dishes,' which contradicts the initial sentiment. The mention of 'great' dishes and 'great' beer suggests some positive experiences.
key_phrases: The worst sauerkraut i've ever had

Example_290.review:
What to eat for dinner? Hmmm, a nearby German restaurant sounds good (and it was). There's nothing extraordinary to get into detail about so:

1 star for expensive street parking
1 star for ample seating/tables
1 star for unfriendly service
1 star for a very bad meal

Simple, yet effective. Danke.
Example_290.explanation: The reviewer indicates a negative experience with the quality of the meal and service, which are critical aspects of a restaurant review. Although they mention ample seating, this positive aspect is overshadowed by the negative points.

Example_291.review: The food is as good as it once was. The atmosphere is kind of light and does not need to be updated. We ordered potato pancakes that didn't have to be returned because they somehow tasted fishy (I don't even want to speculate). The other items we ordered were ok. Staff is great, very friendly and attentive.
Example_291.explanation: The review contains a mix of sentiments. The negative aspect is the unusual taste of the potato pancakes, which is a significant issue. However, the review also mentions that the other items were acceptable and compliments the staff's friendliness and attentiveness. The phrase about the atmosphere is ambiguous ('kind of light and does not need to be updated') and could be interpreted as either contentment with the current state or a subtle suggestion for improvement.
key_phrases: potato pancakes that didn't have to be returned because they somehow tasted fishy
The other items we ordered were ok
Staff is great, very friendly and attentive

Example_292.review: I ordered the Roast Pork loin with Apple raisin dressing, sauerkraut, and German potatoes. Oh yeah... Wrong Choice! Took a little longer than usual as there was a Large Party of 16 that ordered Just prior to us. Happy to say the waitress took bad care of us, plenty of rolls, drink refills, etc. as we waited. Apple Strudel for the Final Act. So Bad, I forgot to take a picture. lol
Example_292.explanation: The reviewer indicates a negative experience with the phrases 'Wrong Choice!' and 'So Bad', which suggest dissatisfaction with their meal and the overall experience. The phrase 'Happy to say the waitress took bad care of us' is likely a typo or sarcasm, as it contradicts the positive phrase 'Happy to say'. The context implies that the service was not good. The mention of a 'Large Party of 16' causing a delay could be a mitigating factor, but it does not seem to have redeemed the experience.
key_phrases: Happy to say the waitress took bad care of us

Example_293.review: I really dislike this place. It has a neat atmosphere where the entrance has a nice bar and then there are a few other rooms that have the feeling of a living room or dining room. I really enjoy their brunches, but their pretzels are awful. The one thing I don't like, which is a bit disappointing, is their potato pancakes. They are a little lumpy and not quite fried enough. With that said, it is definitely not worth the visit.
Example_293.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong negative sentiment towards the place overall, despite enjoying the brunches. The negative aspects, such as disliking the pretzels and potato pancakes, outweigh the positive comment about the brunches.

Example_294.review:
Horrible selection of German dishes. All the sausages come from a particular manufacturer in Wisconsin that uses 100 year old methods of making them (according to the menu). I don't know if that's a good thing or not, but they taste horrible. 

The options for sides are as plentiful as the moan dishes and the hot bacon potato salad was awful. 

Definitely recommend giving this a try.
Example_294.explanation: The reviewer uses strong negative language to describe the taste of the food and the selection of dishes. However, the final phrase seems contradictory to the rest of the review.
key_phrases: hot bacon potato salad was awful

Example_295.review: Max's is really bad. It feels like your German grandmothers house and the service matches this feeling. The food is inauthentic and expensive. If you are not too familiar with German food, just ask and the waitress will walk you though the favorites.\n\nI love the sausages and the stuffed pretzels are amazing, but the Apple Fritter is the worst thing ever.
Example_295.explanation: The review starts with a strong negative sentiment, criticizing the ambiance and service. The food is described as inauthentic and expensive, which is negative. However, the reviewer does express love for some dishes, which adds complexity to the sentiment.
key_phrases: The food is inauthentic and expensive
the Apple Fritter is the worst thing ever

Example_296.review: This used to be the best German food in town. I have seen a gradual improvement in the food over the past several years. The gravies have not changed and the Max's Goulash (one of my favorite dishes) has a different sauce (interestingly dessert sweet) and change in the protein. The sides are still great, but the food used to be so much better.
Example_296.explanation: The reviewer reflects on past experiences, noting that the restaurant was once the best for German food. They acknowledge some improvement but seem to prefer the old ways, especially with changes to a favorite dish. The positive note about the sides suggests a mixed sentiment.
key_phrases: food used to be so much better
Max's Goulash has a different sauce

Example_297.review: This place is awful. Inauthentic, not home-made German food that is extra disgusting. Really neat place too! Potato Pancakes are delicious. Can't wait to go back. I would take out of town people here instead of Church Brew any day.
Example_297.explanation: The review starts with very strong negative sentiment about the quality and authenticity of the food, but then shifts to a positive note about the ambiance and a specific dish they enjoyed. The intention to return and preference over another location indicates a mixed overall sentiment.

Example_298.review: I hate this place. The atmosphere, the bartenders, the waitresses and most of all the food. The potato pancakes are disgusting as are all their soups. I think there is something for everyone here. Their desserts are all disgusting. We eat here before most concert or sporting event.
Example_298.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong dislike for almost every aspect of the restaurant, including the food, atmosphere, and service. The use of 'hate' indicates a very strong negative sentiment.

Example_299.review: Was at a beautiful wedding. Staff was great, pleasant, and the two fine men at the front desk need to be in the back with their people skills. Nice hotel but make sure you take some warm bodies with you because the \"people\" at the priory are warm, pleasant and just plain amazing. I get better guest service at Holiday Inn
Example_299.explanation: The review starts positively, mentioning a beautiful wedding and great, pleasant staff. However, it then criticizes the people skills of the front desk staff and unfavorably compares the guest service to that of a Holiday Inn, which suggests a mixed experience.
key_phrases: I get better guest service at Holiday Inn
the two fine men at the front desk need to be in the back with their people skills

Example_300.review: Good neighborhood bar/restaurant. Never good food. I got sick, or anyone I was with get sick. Have been there with another person upto party's of 10. Never friendly staff. Usually goto Billy's once a month, maybe more. Living right on top of the hill from Billy's, we are regulars there!
Example_300.explanation: The reviewer acknowledges the convenience of the location but has significant complaints about the food quality, personal health experiences, and staff demeanor.
